<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	10 &#13;&#10;Alterations or any other Alterations that are not Permitted Alterations (as the case may be, &quot;Other &#13;&#10;Alterations&quot;) without the prior written consent of Landlord, which consent shall not be &#13;&#10;unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. During the term of this Lease, Tenant may install &#13;&#10;on the Premises such trade fixtures and equipment as Tenant deems necessary for its business &#13;&#10;activities; provided that the installation and use of all such trade fixtures and equipment shall be &#13;&#10;in compliance with any and all applicable governmental laws, rules, regulations and ordinances &#13;&#10;and if the installation of any such trade fixtures or equipment would require modification to the &#13;&#10;structural elements or Systems of the Premises or any part thereof then the same shall be deemed &#13;&#10;Permitted Structural Alterations. All such Alterations shall be completed in a good and &#13;&#10;workmanlike manner incorporating materials comparable to that which exist in the affected &#13;&#10;portions of the Premises and, in any event, in &quot;good condition,&quot; and upon completion thereof &#13;&#10;Tenant shall deliver to Landlord copies of (x) any certificate of occupancy required by any &#13;&#10;governmental authorities to have been issued therefor and (y) plans and specifications prepared &#13;&#10;by a certified architect depicting such Alterations as installed. Minor decorations to the Premises, &#13;&#10;such as moveable partitions, carpeting, painting and wallpapering, shall not constitute Alterations. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, all Alterations shall be subject to the &#13;&#10;following conditions: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Tenant shall pay, or cause to be paid, the entire cost of the &#13;&#10;Alterations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. With respect to any Permitted Structural Alteration or any Other &#13;&#10;Alteration that, in Landlord&#39;s reasonable judgment, would &#13;&#10;materially adversely affect the value or the utility of the Premises, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall, at Landlord&#39;s election (a &quot;Restoration Election&quot;), &#13;&#10;either (as Landlord shall elect in its Restoration Election) (x) restore &#13;&#10;the affected area to the condition in which it existed prior to such &#13;&#10;Alteration or (y) otherwise remove the Alteration in a manner that &#13;&#10;leaves the Premises in a safe and secure, structurally sound, &#13;&#10;weather-tight and architecturally whole condition and in &#13;&#10;compliance with applicable law. A Restoration Election may be &#13;&#10;made at any time up until the later to occur of (i) one (I) year prior &#13;&#10;to the natural expiration of the term of this Lease or (ii) in the event &#13;&#10;of any early termination of this Lease within ten (I 0) days following &#13;&#10;the later to occur of (A) the date of such early termination or (B) not &#13;&#10;more than ten (I 0) days after Tenant shall have afforded Landlord &#13;&#10;all plans, specifications and other information and access &#13;&#10;reasonably requested by Landlord. Notwithstanding the foregoing &#13;&#10;sentence, Tenant may at any time request in writing that Landlord &#13;&#10;either make or decline to make a Restoration Election with respect &#13;&#10;to any particular proposed Alterations (prior to Tenant&#39;s making the &#13;&#10;same) and if Tenant makes such request and provides to Landlord &#13;&#10;all plans, specifications and other information and access &#13;&#10;reasonably requested by Landlord in order for Landlord to make a &#13;&#10;reasonably informed decision as to whether to make a Restoration &#13;&#10;Election then Landlord will, within 30 days after receiving &#13;&#10;all such &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage235"></A>

	&nbsp;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	11 &#13;&#10;information, inform Tenant in writing as to whether Landlord is &#13;&#10;making or declining to make such Restoration Election, with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s failure to make such Restoration Election being deemed &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s having declined to make the same. If Landlord makes a &#13;&#10;Restoration Election, Tenant may then elect not to make the &#13;&#10;proposed Alterations, provided that if Tenant shall thereafter &#13;&#10;perform the Alternations then Tenant shall perform the restoration &#13;&#10;or removal work required therefor at its sole cost, which work shall &#13;&#10;be deemed Alterations to the extent applicable under the terms of &#13;&#10;this Section 8. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;C. Tenant shall keep the Premises free from and promptly remove any &#13;&#10;mechanic&#39;s liens and indemnify, defend, and hold Landlord &#13;&#10;harmless from any and all liability or expense of any kind and &#13;&#10;description (including reasonable attorneys&#39; fees) which may arise &#13;&#10;out of or be connected in any way with Tenant&#39;s Alterations. Any &#13;&#10;mechanic&#39;s lien filed against the Premises or for Alterations or &#13;&#10;materials furnished to Tenant shall be discharged by Tenant within &#13;&#10;thirty (30) days of Tenant becoming aware of its filing, at Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;sole expense, by payment or filing of a bond satisfactory to &#13;&#10;Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;D. Tenant shall hold Landlord harmless from all claims, losses, &#13;&#10;liabilities, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorney&#39;s &#13;&#10;fees) resulting from any Alterations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;E. Tenant shall obtain and pay for all necessary permits and approvals and &#13;&#10;shall comply with all applicable governmental requirements and &#13;&#10;insurance rating bureau recommendations, including complying with &#13;&#10;any rules and regulations related to the handling or removal of asbestos &#13;&#10;containing materials; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;F. Tenant or Tenant&#39;s contractor&#39;s shall carry builder&#39;s risk insurance &#13;&#10;covering all Alterations, in form and amounts and with companies &#13;&#10;satisfactory to Landlord, naming Landlord and Mortgagee (as &#13;&#10;defined herein), if any, as an additional insured. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Tenant shall remain the owner of all trade fixtures and equipment installed &#13;&#10;in the Premises, as well as those Alterations and fixtures (such fixtures, as distinguished from &#13;&#10;&quot;trade fixtures&quot; and &quot;equipment,&quot; being herein referred to as &quot;Permanent Fixtures&quot;) which are part &#13;&#10;of Tenant&#39;s business operations and functions conducted at the Premises (any such Alterations and &#13;&#10;Permanent Fixtures being, individually or collectively, &quot;Business Installations&quot;). Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;entitled to remove Business Installations at any time but at the expiration of the term of this Lease &#13;&#10;shall be obligated to remove any such Business Installations for which Landlord shall have made &#13;&#10;a Restoration Election in accordance with clause (B) of Section 8(a), subject to the requirements &#13;&#10;of Section 18 below. In any event, in connection with any removal of Business Installations &#13;&#10;Tenant shall (x) restore the affected area to the condition in which it &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023142.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 142" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	12 &#13;&#10;existed prior to the initial installation thereof or (y) otherwise remove the same in a manner that &#13;&#10;leaves the Premises in a safe and secure, structurally sound, weather-tight and architecturally &#13;&#10;whole condition and in compliance with applicable law. Landlord hereby waives any and all rights &#13;&#10;it may have to any statutory, pre-judgment landlord&#39;s lien and/or rights of distraint on the Business &#13;&#10;Installations, as well as on any of Tenant&#39;s trade fixtures, equipment, goods, inventory and other &#13;&#10;personal property located within the Premises (collectively, &quot;Tenant&#39;s Property&quot;). If requested by &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s lender holding a lien on Tenant&#39;s Property (&quot;Tenant&#39;s Lender&quot;), Landlord shall promptly &#13;&#10;execute and deliver an instrument in form reasonably satisfactory to Tenant&#39;s Lender and &#13;&#10;Landlord, which form shall (i) provide for Landlord&#39;s consent to the Lender&#39;s lien on any of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s Property (&quot;Collateral&quot;), (ii) provide for Landlord&#39;s subordination to the Lender&#39;s lien of &#13;&#10;any right to levy or distrain the Collateral (and confirming Landlord&#39;s subordination to the &#13;&#10;Lender&#39;s lien of any statutory lien on the Collateral) and (iii) afford Tenant&#39;s Lender the &#13;&#10;opportunity to enter the Premises in order to remove the Collateral on reasonable terms and &#13;&#10;conditions (including without limitation, the condition that Tenant&#39;s Lender pay Landlord any per &#13;&#10;diem amounts due under Section 20 hereof with respect to any period of time in which the &#13;&#10;Collateral remains on the Premises after the termination of this Lease, restore any damage caused &#13;&#10;by such removal and otherwise remove such collateral in accordance with any requirements of &#13;&#10;clause (B) of Section 8(a) above or Section 18 below as are applicable to the particular Collateral, &#13;&#10;and indemnify Landlord from any damage or liability caused to Landlord by such entry and &#13;&#10;removal activities including reasonable attorneys&#39; fees incurred by Landlord in connection &#13;&#10;therewith. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9. Insurance and Indemnity. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Liability Insurance. Tenant shall, at Tenant&#39;s sole expense, during the entire &#13;&#10;term hereof, keep in full force and effect a policy of commercial general liability insurance with &#13;&#10;respect to the Premises, and the business operated by Tenant in the Premises, in which the primary &#13;&#10;coverage per accident or occurrence is not less than $1,000,000.00 of primary combined single &#13;&#10;limit and the umbrella coverage per accident or occurrence is not less than $15,000,000.00 in the &#13;&#10;aggregate. Each such policy shall name Landlord and any Mortgagee as an additional insured. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Property Insurance. Tenant shall, at Tenant&#39;s sole expense, during the entire &#13;&#10;term hereof, keep in full force and effect a policy of special form property insurance against fire, &#13;&#10;vandalism, malicious mischief, and such other hazards as are from time to time included in a ISO &#13;&#10;Special Form Causes of Loss form or its equivalent, insuring the Premises in an amount equal to &#13;&#10;the full replacement value of the Improvements (with an agreed amount endorsement, or no &#13;&#10;coinsurance form), and all Tenant&#39;s Property, in an amount equal to the full replacement value thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Contractors&#39; Insurance. At all times when any work is in process in connection &#13;&#10;with the performance of any Alterations, Tenant shall require all contractors and subcontractors to &#13;&#10;maintain the following insurance: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Commercial general liability insurance in the amount of One &#13;&#10;Million ($1,000,000.00) Dollars insuring Landlord and Mortgagee, &#13;&#10;if any, as additional insureds; &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023143.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 143" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	13 &#13;&#10;(ii) the insurance required under clause (F) of Section 8(a) above; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) Worker&#39;s Compensation, as required by law; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iv) Automobile liability insurance, including but not limited to, &#13;&#10;passenger liability, on all owned, non-owned and hired vehicles in &#13;&#10;connection with the Premises, with a combined single limit per &#13;&#10;occurrence of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00) for &#13;&#10;bodily injury and property damage. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Requirements. The policies required under this Article 9 may be furnished &#13;&#10;by Tenant under any blanket policy carried by it (provided the minimum limits set forth above are &#13;&#10;applicable to the Premises) or under a separate policy therefor. The insurance shall be with carriers &#13;&#10;with a Best Insurance rating of &quot;A-&quot; or better and a financial size rating of &quot;VIII&quot; or better and &#13;&#10;qualified to do business in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Certificates of the insurers, on &#13;&#10;the ACORD standard or equivalent forms, evidencing the maintenance of such insurance policies &#13;&#10;shall be delivered to Landlord prior to commencement of the term of this Lease and, upon &#13;&#10;renewals, not less than ten (10) days prior to the expiration of a coverage period. At any time during &#13;&#10;which Tenant satisfies the Financial Prerequisite, Tenant may self-retain any losses up to a &#13;&#10;maximum amount determined appropriate by Tenant. At any time after the third (3rd) year of the &#13;&#10;term of this Lease, any minimum dollar coverage requirements set forth herein shall be subject to &#13;&#10;increase to levels customarily required by landlords of similar properties in eastern Massachusetts, &#13;&#10;upon Landlord&#39;s election by notice to Tenant therefor given from time to time (but not more than &#13;&#10;once in any given period of three (3) years). Prior to the last two (2) years of the term of this Lease, &#13;&#10;Tenant alone will be entitled to adjust any losses and to receive insurance proceeds (provided that &#13;&#10;Tenant shall keep Landlord reasonably apprised of, and afford Landlord the reasonable &#13;&#10;opportunity to advise and consult in, but with no approval authority over the adjustment process) &#13;&#10;but in any event, to the extent necessary, Tenant shall use such proceeds for purposes of complying &#13;&#10;with any Tenant&#39;s repair, restoration and rebuilding obligations hereunder. Notwithstanding the &#13;&#10;foregoing, if at any time Tenant does not satisfy the Financial Prerequisite then such proceeds &#13;&#10;shall not be received by Tenant but, rather, shall be paid to the first priority Mortgagee or, if there &#13;&#10;is no Mortgagee, a bank, trust company or institutional escrow agent reasonably satisfactory to &#13;&#10;the parties, to be disbursed for the foregoing purposes on terms and conditions reasonably required &#13;&#10;by Landlord or the first priority Mortgagee (which may include, without limitation, those that an &#13;&#10;institutional construction lender would customarily and reasonably require for disbursement of &#13;&#10;construction loan proceeds). During the last two (2) years of the term of this Lease, Landlord &#13;&#10;alone will be entitled to adjust any losses and to receive insurance proceeds (provided that &#13;&#10;Landlord shall keep Tenant reasonably apprised of, and afford Tenant the reasonable opportunity &#13;&#10;to advise and consult in, but with no approval authority over the adjustment process) but in any &#13;&#10;event Landlord shall make such proceeds timely available to Tenant for purposes of Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;complying with its repair, restoration and rebuilding obligations hereunder on terms and &#13;&#10;conditions reasonably imposed by Landlord or any first priority Mortgagee (which may include, &#13;&#10;without limitation, those that an institutional construction lender would customarily and &#13;&#10;reasonably require for disbursement of construction loan proceeds). &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	14 &#13;&#10;(e) Tenant&#39;s Indemnity. Tenant shall defend, indemnify and save Landlord &#13;&#10;harmless against and from any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities and expenses (including &#13;&#10;reasonable attorneys&#39; fees), arising out of (a) Tenant&#39;s use or occupancy of the Premises or the &#13;&#10;occurrence of any nuisance on the Property, (b) the conduct or management of the business &#13;&#10;conducted by Tenant or any subtenant or other occupant in the Premises, (c) any breach or default &#13;&#10;on the part of the Tenant in the performance of any covenant or agreement on the part of the &#13;&#10;Tenant to be performed pursuant to the terms of this Lease, and (d) any act or negligence of &#13;&#10;Tenant, its agents, contractors, servants, guests, employees, subtenants, concessionaires or &#13;&#10;licensees on or in the Premises or its appurtenances. In case any action or proceeding is brought &#13;&#10;against Landlord by reason of any such claim, Tenant, upon notice from Landlord, shall defend &#13;&#10;such action or proceeding which is brought against Landlord by reason of any such claim. Tenant, &#13;&#10;upon notice from Landlord, covenants to defend such action or proceeding by counsel reasonably &#13;&#10;satisfactory to Landlord, provided that Landlord hereby approves any such counsel reasonably &#13;&#10;appointed by Tenant&#39;s insurance company. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Subrogation. Tenant and Landlord hereby release each other and its or their &#13;&#10;respective officers, directors, employees and agents from any and all liability or responsibility (or &#13;&#10;anyone claiming through or under them by way of subrogation or otherwise) for any loss or &#13;&#10;damage to property covered by insurance required maintained by the said party and shall maintain &#13;&#10;insurance policies requiring such release. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(g) Landlord&#39;s Indemnity. Landlord shall defend, indemnify and save Tenant &#13;&#10;harmless from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities and expenses (including &#13;&#10;reasonable attorneys&#39; fees) arising out of (a) any breach or default on the part of the Landlord in &#13;&#10;the performance of any covenant or agreement on the part of the Landlord to be performed &#13;&#10;pursuant to the terms of this Lease, and (b) any negligence of Landlord, its agents, contractors, &#13;&#10;servants, guests, employees, tenants (other than Tenant), concessionaires or licensees on or about &#13;&#10;the Premises. In case any action or proceeding is brought against Tenant by reason of any such &#13;&#10;claim, Landlord, upon notice from Tenant, shall defend such action or proceeding which is &#13;&#10;brought against Tenant by reason of any such claim. Landlord, upon notice from Tenant, &#13;&#10;covenants to defend such action or proceeding by counsel reasonably satisfactory to Tenant, &#13;&#10;provided that Tenant hereby approves any such counsel reasonably appointed by Landlord&#39;s &#13;&#10;insurance company. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;10. Damage or Destruction. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) If during the term of this Lease the Premises, or any portion thereof, are &#13;&#10;destroyed or damaged by fire, explosion, or any other event whatsoever (a &quot;casualty&quot;), then Tenant &#13;&#10;shall, as soon as practicable (after receipt of insurance proceeds, but only if and to the extent that &#13;&#10;(i) Tenant shall have been required hereunder to insure the same, (ii) Tenant shall have in fact &#13;&#10;maintained such insurance as required hereunder and (iii) Tenant shall have proceeded to adjust &#13;&#10;the insured loss diligently and in good faith), repair, restore, and rebuild the Premises to a &#13;&#10;condition substantially equivalent to that existing prior to such casualty, and shall do so each time &#13;&#10;and as often as any portion of the Premises shall be destroyed or damaged, regardless of whether &#13;&#10;such casualty is covered by any insurance policy maintained by Tenant. Except as expressly &#13;&#10;provided in Section 1O(b), below, no damage or destruction of any building or any of the fixtures &#13;&#10;or other property therein shall be grounds for the termination of this Lease &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage239"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	15 &#13;&#10;or relieve the Tenant from any obligation created or imposed by virtue of this Lease; any laws of &#13;&#10;the state in which the Premises is located to the contrary notwithstanding, including, but without &#13;&#10;limiting the generality of the foregoing, Tenant&#39;s obligation to make payment of the rent and all &#13;&#10;other charges on the part of the Tenant to be paid, and the Tenant&#39;s obligation to perform all other &#13;&#10;covenants and agreements on the part of the Tenant to be performed. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Lease to the contrary, if &#13;&#10;Improvements, the replacement value of which shall exceed 50% or more of the replacement value &#13;&#10;of all Improvements at the Premises are damaged or destroyed by fire or other casualty during the &#13;&#10;last two (2) years of the term hereof and if, in Tenant&#39;s reasonable opinion supported by the written &#13;&#10;opinion of third party experts (&quot;Third Party Reports&quot;), it will reasonably take more than 270 days &#13;&#10;from the date of adjustment of the loss with the insurance carrier to restore the Improvements to &#13;&#10;their condition immediately prior to such casualty, then Landlord and Tenant each shall have the &#13;&#10;right to terminate this Lease by giving the other party written notice of such termination within &#13;&#10;ninety (90) days after the date of such damage or destruction, specifying a termination date of a &#13;&#10;least one hundred twenty (120) days after the date of such notice of termination. Notwithstanding &#13;&#10;anything to the contrary contained herein, Tenant&#39;s termination right under this Section IO(b) is &#13;&#10;expressly conditioned on Tenant&#39;s giving Landlord notice, within thirty (30) days of the casualty, &#13;&#10;that Tenant intends on producing the Third Party Report and in fact produces the Third Party &#13;&#10;Report within sixty (60) days of the fire or other casualty. If this Lease is terminated as aforesaid, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall pay or cause to be paid to Landlord on or prior to the date of termination, insurance &#13;&#10;proceeds or a direct payment from Tenant or any combination of the two, in an aggregate amount &#13;&#10;equal to (i) the proceeds of all insurance maintained by Tenant hereunder covering such loss plus &#13;&#10;(ii) any deductible or other self-retained amount covering such loss, plus (iii) any remaining &#13;&#10;amount necessary so that Landlord shall have received in full the reasonably estimated cost to &#13;&#10;repair, restore and rebuild the Improvements to their condition immediately prior to such casualty. &#13;&#10;Upon such payment and termination, Tenant shall have no further liability to Landlord except for &#13;&#10;any terms and conditions that expressly survive the termination of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11. Public Taking. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) If all or substantially all of the Premises shall be sold to or taken by any &#13;&#10;public authority under its power of condemnation or the threat thereof, this Lease shall terminate &#13;&#10;as of the date possession shall be transferred to the acquiring authority, and the rental payable &#13;&#10;hereunder shall be apportioned accordingly. Upon any taking of less than substantially all of the &#13;&#10;Premises, this Lease shall continue in force as to the part of the Premises not taken. In the event &#13;&#10;of any such partial taking, Tenant, at Tenant&#39;s sole cost except as otherwise provided herein, shall, &#13;&#10;upon the availability of the funds therefor to Tenant as hereinafter provided (and subject to the &#13;&#10;effect of such taking), diligently rebuild or restore the remainder of the Premises to the condition &#13;&#10;in which they existed at the time of such taking. Except as herein specifically provided otherwise, &#13;&#10;all damages awarded by or amounts paid by the acquiring authority for any such taking, whether &#13;&#10;for the whole or a part of the Premises, shall belong to and be the property of Landlord; provided &#13;&#10;that Tenant shall have the right to make its separate claim for compensation for any loss or damage &#13;&#10;it suffers to its trade fixtures and for statutory relocation expenses. In the event of a partial taking &#13;&#10;any proceeds received by Landlord shall first be applied to reimburse Tenant for the costs of &#13;&#10;rebuilding or restoring the Premises to its condition at the time of taking &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	16 &#13;&#10;(subject to the effect of such taking) on reasonable terms and conditions (which may include, &#13;&#10;without limitation, those that an institutional construction lender would customarily and &#13;&#10;reasonably require for disbursement of construction loan proceeds). Notwithstanding the &#13;&#10;foregoing, Tenant shall not be required to complete any restoration under this Section 11 the cost &#13;&#10;of which exceeds the funds made available to Tenant therefor as provided hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Lease to the contrary, (i) if &#13;&#10;more than fifty percent (50%) of the gross building floor area of the Premises are taken during the &#13;&#10;last year of the term of this Lease, or (ii) such lesser amount that would prevent the Tenant from &#13;&#10;operating the Tenant&#39;s business as operated in the ordinary course prior to such taking, or &#13;&#10;(iii) if access is taken such that the Premises no longer have reasonable vehicular and/or &#13;&#10;pedestrian access, or (iv) if the parking areas of the Premises are taken such that the remaining &#13;&#10;available parking does not meet the legal requirements therefor, then in any such event or events, &#13;&#10;Landlord and Tenant each shall have the right to terminate this Lease by giving to the other written &#13;&#10;notice of such termination within thitiy (30) days after the date of such taking, specifying a &#13;&#10;termination date of at least sixty (60) days and not more than ninety (90) days after the date of &#13;&#10;notice of termination. Failure to give notice of termination within such thirty (30) day period shall &#13;&#10;be deemed to be a waiver of such right of termination. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a &#13;&#10;termination right made under clause (iv) hereof shall only be effective after Landlord has been &#13;&#10;given a reasonable opportunity (not to exceed sixty (60) days after the date of such taking) to &#13;&#10;replicate the parking at an offsite location reasonably acceptable to Tenant in Tenant&#39;s business &#13;&#10;judgment. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) In the event of a condemnation which does not result in a termination of &#13;&#10;this Lease then in that event the Base Rent payable hereunder and any other item in this Lease &#13;&#10;which is based upon the relative size of the Premises (including but not limited to the size of the &#13;&#10;Leased Parcel and the Improvements) shall be adjusted and decreased on a pro rata basis from and &#13;&#10;after the date of taking. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12. Assignment and Subletting. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, Tenant shall have no right &#13;&#10;to assign or transfer this Lease, sublet all or any part of the Premises, grant a mortgage on Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;leasehold interest under this Lease or otherwise hypothecate any interest of Tenant hereunder, or &#13;&#10;grant a license or other use or occupancy right to any other person or entity to use all or any part &#13;&#10;of the Premises, whether voluntarily, involuntarily or by operation of law or whether directly or &#13;&#10;indirectly (any of the foregoing being a &quot;Transfer&quot;), in each case without the prior written consent &#13;&#10;of Landlord, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant may engage in any of the following transactions (each, a &#13;&#10;&quot;Permitted Transfer&quot;) without the consent of the Landlord: (i) the sublease or assignment of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s interest under this Lease (the &quot;Tenant Interest&quot;) to any Tenant Affiliate; (ii) a sublease or &#13;&#10;assignment to any entity in connection with a public offering of stock by Tenant; or (iii) a &#13;&#10;transaction pursuant to which Tenant is merged or consolidated with any other entity or pursuant &#13;&#10;to which all or substantially all of Tenant&#39;s assets (including, without limitation, the Tenant &#13;&#10;Interest) are sold or transferred as a &quot;going concern&quot; and in a single transaction; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that in any such case (A) the Transfer shall be made in good faith and for a legitimate &#13;&#10;business purpose other than circumventing the restrictions on Transfer &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	17 &#13;&#10;otherwise applicable under this Section 12, (B) except in the case of a Transfer under clause (i) &#13;&#10;immediately above, either (x) at the time of the proposed Transfer, each of Tenant and any &#13;&#10;applicable proposed transferee satisfy the Financial Prerequisite or (y) immediately following the &#13;&#10;Transfer the entity comprising Tenant shall have a Tangible Net Worth at least equal to that of &#13;&#10;Tenant as of the Effective Date (the &quot;Original Net Worth&quot;) provided that commencing on the first &#13;&#10;day after the conclusion of the first twelve (12) full calendar months of the term, and then &#13;&#10;continuing annually thereafter on the one (1) year anniversary of such date, the Original Net Worth &#13;&#10;shall be deemed increased by 1.75% above the Original Net Worth in effect for the previous year, &#13;&#10;(C) Tenant shall have given Landlord at least fifteen (15) days&#39; prior written notice of any intended &#13;&#10;Permitted Transfer (which notice shall contain information reasonably necessary for Landlord to &#13;&#10;conclude that Tenant&#39;s intended transaction qualifies as a Permitted Transfer), and (D) the &#13;&#10;Permitted Transfer shall be subject to all of the other terms and conditions of this Lease. For the &#13;&#10;purposes of this Lease, the entering into of any management agreement or any agreement in the &#13;&#10;nature thereof transferring control of the business operations of Tenant in the Premises as well as &#13;&#10;any substantial percentage of the profits and losses thereof to a person or entity other than Tenant, &#13;&#10;or otherwise having substantially the same effect, shall be treated for all purposes as a Transfer of &#13;&#10;this Lease and shall be governed by the provisions of this Section 12. As used herein: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Financial Prerequisite&quot; shall mean and be deemed to be satisfied with respect to any &#13;&#10;applicable Tenant Entity (as defined herein) if, at the applicable time (as the context shall &#13;&#10;provide for hereunder), the Tenant Entity is a US domiciled corporation for which either &#13;&#10;(i) the corporation&#39;s common stock is traded on a US public securities exchange or (ii) the &#13;&#10;corporation&#39;s Tangible Net Worth is at least two billion dollars ($2,000,000,000.00) (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Minimum Net Worth&quot;), provided that commencing on the first day after the conclusion &#13;&#10;of the first twelve (12) full calendar months of the term, and then continuing annually &#13;&#10;thereafter on the one (1) year anniversary of such date, the Minimum Net Worth shall be &#13;&#10;increased by 1.75% above the previous year&#39;s Minimum Net Worth; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Tangible Net Worth&quot; shall mean, with respect to any Tenant Entity, the excess of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Entity&#39;s total assets over total liabilities, in each case as determined in accordance &#13;&#10;with generally accepted accounting principles consistently applied (&quot;GAAP&quot;), but &#13;&#10;excluding, however, from the determination of total assets all assets that would be &#13;&#10;classified as intangible assets under GAAP (including without limitation goodwill, &#13;&#10;licenses, patents, trademarks, trade names, copyrights, and franchises); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Tenant Affiliate&quot; shall mean any entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under &#13;&#10;common control with Tenant; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Tenant Entity&quot; shall mean the holder of the Tenant&#39;s interest under this Lease at any given &#13;&#10;time (or, in the context specifically provided for in Section 12(a), its transferee). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) In the event Tenant desires to enter into a Transfer which requires &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s consent, Tenant shall notify Landlord in writing at least thirty (30) days in advance of &#13;&#10;the proposed effective date of Transfer (the &quot;First Request&quot;) of Tenant&#39;s intent to so Transfer, the &#13;&#10;proposed effective date of such Transfer and the terms and conditions of the Transfer including &#13;&#10;all rent and other consideration to be paid by the proposed transferee (&quot;Transfer Information&quot;), &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	18 &#13;&#10;and shall request in such notification that Landlord consent thereto. Landlord shall respond to the &#13;&#10;First Request within ten (10) business days of its receipt thereof (including its receipt of all &#13;&#10;Transfer Information required to be included therein). If Landlord denies the First Request the &#13;&#10;response shall set forth the reasons therefor, which may include, in Landlord&#39;s sole discretion, a &#13;&#10;request for additional reasonable Transfer Information. If Landlord responds to the First Request &#13;&#10;by denying its consent or if Landlord fails to timely respond to the First Request, Tenant may send &#13;&#10;Landlord an additional request (the &quot;Second Request&quot;), which Second Request shall contain any &#13;&#10;and all additional reasonable Transfer Information requested by Landlord pursuant to its response &#13;&#10;to the First Request. Failure of Landlord to respond to the Second Request within ten &#13;&#10;(10) business days of Landlord&#39;s receipt thereof shall constitute approval of the Second Request. &#13;&#10;In any event, upon request, Tenant shall promptly provide Landlord with all additional &#13;&#10;information relating to any proposed Transfer as may be reasonably requested by Landlord. If &#13;&#10;Landlord consents in writing to a Transfer, such consent shall be deemed conditioned upon &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s compliance with the provisions of Section 12(c) below within ninety (90) days of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s consent (or any shorter period as may be applicable as set forth in Section I2(c)) and &#13;&#10;the failure to so comply in a timely manner shall be deemed to give Landlord reasonable cause &#13;&#10;for withholding or withdrawing its consent. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) (i) Except for a Permitted Transfer, the Transfer must be, in the &#13;&#10;case of a sublease, a commercially leasable space and, in the case of an assignment, a transfer to &#13;&#10;the transferee of all of Tenant&#39;s rights in and interests under this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) At the time of such Transfer, this Lease must be in full force &#13;&#10;and effect without any Event of Default existing. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) The transferee shall unconditionally assume in the case of &#13;&#10;an assignment, by written recordable instrument, the due performance of all of the obligations of &#13;&#10;the Tenant under this Lease, including any accrued obligations at the time of the assignment. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iv) A copy of the Transfer instrument and the original &#13;&#10;assumption agreement under clause (iii) above fully executed and acknowledged by the transferee, &#13;&#10;shall be delivered to Landlord within ten (10) days from the effective date of such Transfer. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(v) Such Transfer shall be upon and subject to all the &#13;&#10;provisions, terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease including but without limitation all use &#13;&#10;restrictions and restrictions on Transfer hereunder and Tenant (and any transferees of this Lease &#13;&#10;or guarantors of Tenant&#39;s obligations hereunder) shall continue to be and remain primarily and &#13;&#10;unconditionally liable hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(vi) Except for a Permitted Transfer, Tenant shall, within ten &#13;&#10;(10) days of Landlord&#39;s billing Tenant therefor, reimburse Landlord for Landlord&#39;s reasonable &#13;&#10;attorneys&#39; fees for examination of and/or preparation of any documents in connection with such &#13;&#10;assignment or subletting not in excess of $3,000.00 (the &quot;Transfer Fee&quot;) in connection with any &#13;&#10;single assignment or subletting request, provided that commencing on the first day after the &#13;&#10;conclusion of the first twelve (12) full calendar months of the term, and then continuing annually &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	19 &#13;&#10;thereafter on the one (1) year anniversary of such date, the Transfer Fee shall be increased by &#13;&#10;1.75% above the previous year&#39;s Transfer Fee. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) In the case of any assignment or sublet requiring Landlord&#39;s consent as set &#13;&#10;forth above, Tenant will pay to Landlord, within thirty (30) days following Tenant&#39;s receipt &#13;&#10;thereof, 50% of: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) in the case of an assignment, (A) all consideration paid to &#13;&#10;and received by Tenant by the assignee with respect to the value of the leasehold and leasehold &#13;&#10;improvements in excess of the unamortized cost thereof (but not including any value attributable &#13;&#10;to Tenant&#39;s furniture, trade fixtures, equipment, inventory, other personal property, or for good &#13;&#10;will or other intangible assets), less (B) all costs actually paid by Tenant in order to consummate &#13;&#10;such assignment, including but not limited to free rent, brokerage fees, improvement costs, &#13;&#10;moving costs and attorneys&#39; fees (provided that if any of such costs were paid to an affiliate of &#13;&#10;Tenant then those costs shall only be deducted to the extent that they do not exceed what such &#13;&#10;costs would have been had they been paid to an unaffiliated party on an arm&#39;s-length basis); and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) in the case of a sublease, (A) all rents, additional charges or &#13;&#10;other consideration received by Tenant during the term of the sublease, plus (B) any consideration &#13;&#10;received by Tenant for leasehold improvements in excess of their unamortized cost (but not &#13;&#10;including any value attributable to Tenant&#39;s furniture, trade fixtures, equipment, inventory, other &#13;&#10;personal property, or for good will or other intangible assets), less (C) the sum of all Base Rent &#13;&#10;and additional rent thereafter incurred by Tenant under this Lease (or a pro rata portion thereof in &#13;&#10;connection with a partial sublet, to the extent allowed by Landlord), and less &#13;&#10;(D) all costs actually paid by Tenant in order to consummate such sublet, including but not limited &#13;&#10;to brokerage fees, free rent, improvement costs, moving costs and attorneys&#39; fees (provided that &#13;&#10;if any of such costs were paid to a Tenant Affiliate then those costs shall only be deducted to the &#13;&#10;extent that they do not exceed what such costs would have been had they been paid to an &#13;&#10;unaffiliated party on an arm&#39;s-length basis). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Any purported Transfer made without full compliance with the provisions &#13;&#10;of this Section 12 shall, at Landlord&#39;s election, be void and shall confer no rights upon any third &#13;&#10;person. If without conformance to the above process this Lease or the Premises or any part thereof &#13;&#10;shall be transferred or the Premises occupied by anybody other than Tenant, Landlord may collect &#13;&#10;rent from the assignee, subtenant or occupant, and apply the net amount collected to the Base Rent &#13;&#10;and additional rent herein reserved, but no such assignment, subletting, occupancy or collection &#13;&#10;shall be deemed a waiver of the foregoing covenant, or an acceptance of the assignee, subtenant &#13;&#10;or occupant as tenant, or a release of Tenant from full performance hereunder. Except as otherwise &#13;&#10;expressly provided in Section 12(g), Tenant shall remain primarily liable for all of the obligations &#13;&#10;of the Tenant hereunder notwithstanding any assignment by Tenant of any of its rights or interests &#13;&#10;hereunder. Each assignee shall be subject to all of the terms and conditions of this Lease, &#13;&#10;including all restrictions on Transfer. Each sublease shall be subordinate to the terms and &#13;&#10;conditions of this Lease, and any Transfer or attempted Transfer by any subtenant with respect to &#13;&#10;its right, title or interest under the sublease shall be deemed a Transfer or attempted Transfer under &#13;&#10;this Lease. No act or conduct by the Landlord other than its express written consent shall &#13;&#10;constitute its consent or waiver of its &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage244"></A>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023150.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 150" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	20 &#13;&#10;consent rights with respect to a particular Transfer. No Transfer or consent to Transfer will &#13;&#10;operate to waive Landlord&#39;s rights with respect to any future Transfer. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Tenant may from &#13;&#10;time to time, subject to all of the provisions of the Lease, permit portions of the Premises to be &#13;&#10;used under so-called &quot;desk sharing&quot; arrangements by Tenant Related Parties (each such desk or &#13;&#10;office space user, a &quot;Desk Space User&quot;); provided, that (A) each Desk Space User shall use the &#13;&#10;Premises in accordance with all of the provisions of this Lease, and only for the use expressly &#13;&#10;permitted pursuant to this Lease, (B) in no event shall the use of any portion of the Premises by a &#13;&#10;Desk Space User create or be deemed to create any right, title or interest of such Desk Space User &#13;&#10;in any portion of the Premises or under this Lease or any other tenancy or occupancy rights &#13;&#10;whatsoever, (C) such &quot;desk sharing&quot; arrangement shall terminate automatically upon the &#13;&#10;termination of the Lease, and (D) Tenant shall receive no rent or other payment or consideration &#13;&#10;for the use of any space in the Premises by any Desk Space User in excess of an allocable share &#13;&#10;of the rent payable by Tenant under the Lease. As used herein, &quot;Tenant Related Party&quot; shall mean &#13;&#10;any persons or entities with whom Tenant has an ongoing business relationship other than as &#13;&#10;tenants or occupants of the Premises (such as, by way of example, Tenant&#39;s auditors, Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;clients and Tenant&#39;s joint venturers). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(g) Any assignment of this Lease made by Tenant with the consent of Landlord &#13;&#10;and otherwise in compliance with the requirements of this Section 12 shall act to automatically &#13;&#10;relieve Tenant of any further responsibility to Landlord pursuant to this Lease from and after the &#13;&#10;effective date of such assignment; provided, however, that (i) at least ten (10) full years of term &#13;&#10;have occurred and (ii) Tenant provides Landlord with reasonable evidence demonstrating that the &#13;&#10;assignee Tenant Entity meets the Financial Prerequisite at the time of the proposed assignment. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;13. Subordination, Non-Disturbance and Attornment. Tenant agrees that this Lease is &#13;&#10;and shall be and remain subordinate to the interests of any holder (a &quot;Mortgagee&quot;) of any present &#13;&#10;or future mortgage, deed of trust, ground lease or master lease upon all or any part of the Premises &#13;&#10;(each, a &quot;Superior Instrument&quot;), irrespective of the time of execution or time of recording of any &#13;&#10;such Superior Instrument, and to all renewals, extensions thereof, modifications or amendments &#13;&#10;thereto or advances thereunder, as applicable. Upon the request of Landlord or any Mortgagee, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall enter into an attornment agreement with such Mortgagee in the customary form &#13;&#10;reasonably required by such Mortgagee. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant&#39;s subordination &#13;&#10;to any Superior Instrument shall not be effective until such time as Tenant and the Mortgagee &#13;&#10;shall have entered in a Subordination, Non-Disturbance and Attornment Agreement in the form &#13;&#10;of EXHIBIT C annexed hereto and made a part hereof or in another reasonable and customary &#13;&#10;form (an &quot;SNDA&quot;). Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to the contrary contained herein, &#13;&#10;at the request in writing of any Mortgagee, this Lease shall be deemed superior to its Superior &#13;&#10;Instrument, whether this Lease was executed before or after such Superior Instrument, and Tenant &#13;&#10;shall execute such documents in recordable form as the Mortgagee shall request. Notwithstanding &#13;&#10;the foregoing, on the Commencement Date, Landlord shall deliver to Tenant an SNDA executed &#13;&#10;by any Mortgagee at the time thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14. Default. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	21 &#13;&#10;(a) Default/Remedies. If (a) default be made in the payment of Base Rent or &#13;&#10;any additional rent payable hereunder by Tenant, and such default shall continue for ten (10) days &#13;&#10;after written notice of default is delivered to Tenant in accordance with Section 17, or (b) default &#13;&#10;be made in any of the other covenants or conditions herein contained on the part of Tenant and &#13;&#10;such default shall continue for thirty (30) days after written notice thereof shall have been given &#13;&#10;to Tenant in accordance with Section 17 (except that such thirty (30) day period shall be &#13;&#10;automatically extended for such additional period of time as is reasonably necessary to cure such &#13;&#10;default if such default cannot be cured within such first 30 day period and provided Tenant &#13;&#10;commences the process of curing such default within said first 30 day period and continuously &#13;&#10;and diligently pursues such cure to completion), or (c) except as otherwise permitted by this Lease, &#13;&#10;a Transfer is made without the prior written consent of Landlord, or (d) Tenant shall become &#13;&#10;insolvent or bankrupt or make an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or (e) a receiver or trustee &#13;&#10;of Tenant&#39;s or guarantor&#39;s property shall be appointed and such receiver or trustee, as the case may &#13;&#10;be, shall not be discharged within 90 days after such appointment, or (f) Tenant shall be dissolved &#13;&#10;or liquidated or proceedings shall have been commenced to dissolve or liquidate, or (g) Tenant &#13;&#10;shall abandon the Premises and cease to pay rent, or (h) any of the insurance required to be &#13;&#10;maintained under Section 9 shall not be in force and effect, the occurrence of any such event in &#13;&#10;the forgoing clauses (a) through (h) being an &quot;Event of Default,&quot; then, in any such case, Landlord &#13;&#10;may, upon ten (10) days prior notice to Tenant, terminate Tenant&#39;s tenancy and recover possession &#13;&#10;of and reenter the Premises without accepting a surrender of the Premises or affecting Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;liability for past rent and other charges due or future rent and other charges to accrue hereunder. &#13;&#10;In the event of any such default, Landlord shall be entitled to recover from Tenant, in addition to &#13;&#10;rent and additional rent, all other damages sustained by Landlord proximately caused by the &#13;&#10;breach of this Lease, including, but not limited to, the costs, expenses and reasonable attorney fees &#13;&#10;incurred by Landlord in enforcing the terms and provisions hereof and in reentering and &#13;&#10;recovering possession of the Premises and for the cost of repairs, alterations and brokerage and &#13;&#10;reasonable attorney fees connected with the reletting of the Premises. As an alternative, at the &#13;&#10;election of Landlord, Landlord shall have the right to accept a surrender of the Premises (without &#13;&#10;the need for any affirmative act or acquiescence by Tenant), without any further rights or &#13;&#10;obligations on the part of Landlord or Tenant (other than Tenant&#39;s obligation for rent and other &#13;&#10;charges due and owing through the date of acceptance of surrender), so that Landlord may relet &#13;&#10;the Premises without any right on the part of Tenant to any credit or payment resulting from any &#13;&#10;reletting of the Premises. Alternatively, at the option of the Landlord, in the event Tenant&#39;s tenancy &#13;&#10;is so terminated, Landlord may recover forthwith against Tenant as damages for loss of the bargain &#13;&#10;and not as a penalty an aggregate sum, which at the time of such termination of Tenant&#39;s tenancy, &#13;&#10;represents the amount of the excess, if any, of the value of the whole balance of Base Rent, charges &#13;&#10;and all other sums payable hereunder for the entire balance of the term of this Lease herein &#13;&#10;reserved or agreed to be paid by Tenant, over the then current fair market rental value of the &#13;&#10;Premises, such difference to be discounted to present value at a rate equal to two (2) points above &#13;&#10;the Federal Reserve Bank&#39;s discount rate then in effect. In case of a default under this Lease, &#13;&#10;Landlord may, in addition to terminating Tenant&#39;s tenancy and/or accepting a surrender, or in lieu &#13;&#10;thereof, pursue such other legal or equitable remedy or combination of remedies and recover such &#13;&#10;other damages for breach of tenancy and/or contract as available at law or otherwise. All of the &#13;&#10;remedies available to Landlord under this Lease shall be cumulative and may be exercised by &#13;&#10;Landlord in any order or combination that Landlord shall require. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	22 &#13;&#10;(b) Landlord&#39;s Right to Cure. All covenants and agreements to be performed &#13;&#10;by the Tenant under any of the terms of this Lease shall be performed by Tenant at Tenant&#39;s sole &#13;&#10;cost and expense and without any abatement of rent. If the Tenant shall fail to pay any sum of &#13;&#10;money required to be paid by it hereunder, other than rent, or shall fail to perform any other act &#13;&#10;on its part to be performed hereunder, and such failure shall continue for 30 days after notice &#13;&#10;thereof by the Landlord, the Landlord may, but shall not be obligated to, cure such default, without &#13;&#10;waiving or releasing the Tenant from any other default by Tenant under this Lease. All sums so &#13;&#10;paid by the Landlord and all necessary incidental costs (including reasonable attorney&#39;s fees) &#13;&#10;incurred by Landlord in enforcing any of the terms, covenants or conditions of this Lease, or &#13;&#10;curing any default or in suing for or obtaining relief by reason of a breach thereof, together with &#13;&#10;interest on all of the foregoing at the rate set forth below from the date of payment or incurring &#13;&#10;by the Landlord, shall be payable as additional rent to the Landlord on demand. Landlord shall &#13;&#10;have, in addition to any other right or remedy of the Landlord, the same rights and remedies in the &#13;&#10;event of the nonpayment thereof by the Tenant as in the case of default by the Tenant in the &#13;&#10;payment of rent. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Waivers. A waiver by Landlord or by Tenant of a breach or default by the &#13;&#10;other party under the terms and conditions of this Lease shall not be construed to be a waiver of &#13;&#10;any subsequent breach or default nor of any other term or condition of this Lease, and the failure &#13;&#10;of the non-defaulting party to assert any breach or to declare a default by the defaulting party shall &#13;&#10;not be construed to constitute a waiver thereof so long as such breach or default continues &#13;&#10;unremedied. No breach of a covenant or condition of this Lease shall be deemed to have been &#13;&#10;waived by Landlord and/or Tenant, unless such waiver be in writing signed by the waiving party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Landlord&#39;s Default. Landlord shall not be deemed to be in default hereunder &#13;&#10;unless such default shall remain uncured for more than thirty (30) days following written notice &#13;&#10;from Tenant specifying the nature of such default, or such longer period as may be reasonably &#13;&#10;required to correct such default. In no event whatsoever shall Landlord be liable hereunder for &#13;&#10;any consequential, special punitive or any indirect damages notwithstanding anything to the &#13;&#10;contrary set forth in this Lease. In the event Landlord defaults under the terms of this Lease Tenant &#13;&#10;may, subject to the express terms of this Lease, exercise any right or remedy available to Tenant &#13;&#10;at law or in equity on account thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Limit on Tenant Liability. In no event shall Tenant be liable for any indirect &#13;&#10;or consequential damages of Landlord or any other party as a result of any event of default &#13;&#10;hereunder or for any other action or inaction of the Tenant in connection with this Lease. In no &#13;&#10;event shall the members, managers, officers, directors, agents, partners, principals, employees &#13;&#10;and/or shareholders of Tenant have any liability whatsoever for any damages and/or liability &#13;&#10;under this Lease and the Landlord will look solely to the Tenant for the recovery of any damages &#13;&#10;or otherwise under any terms, covenants or conditions contained in this Lease. Landlord hereby &#13;&#10;waives any statutory or common law lien or right of distraint against any and all of Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;customer files and business records. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;15. Costs and Attorney Fees. Should either party hereto commence any legal action &#13;&#10;(excepting any Arbitration, as defined herein) against the other to enforce any obligation under &#13;&#10;this Lease, the prevailing party (as determined in such action) shall be entitled to recover from &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	23 &#13;&#10;the non-prevailing party reasonable attorneys&#39; fees, costs and expenses incurred in contesting &#13;&#10;such dispute. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16. Interest. Any amount due from Landlord or Tenant to the other hereunder which &#13;&#10;is not paid when due, or with respect to any other amount for which this Lease specifically calls &#13;&#10;for the payment of interest, shall bear interest at an annual rate equal to 4% per annum in excess &#13;&#10;of the prime rate of interest published from time to time in the Wall Street Journal-Eastern Edition &#13;&#10;(but in no event shall such rate of interest exceed the maximum rate of interest permitted to be &#13;&#10;charged by law) from the date due until paid, compounded monthly, but the payment of such &#13;&#10;interest shall not excuse or cure any default by Landlord or Tenant under this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17. 	24 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;ScarinciHollenbeck &#13;&#10;1100 Valley Brook Avenue &#13;&#10;Lyndhurst, NJ 07071 &#13;&#10;Attention: Victor E. Kinon, Esq. &#13;&#10;Telephone: (201) 896-4100 &#13;&#10;Email: vkinon@sh-law.com &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Any party may, upon prior notice to the others, specify a different address for the giving &#13;&#10;of notice. Notices shall be effective on the date of personal service or one day after sending if sent &#13;&#10;by overnight courier or two (2) Business Days after sending if sent by certified mail, return receipt &#13;&#10;requested. As used herein, &quot;Business Day&quot; shall mean any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or &#13;&#10;holiday recognized by banks in Massachusetts. Either party (a &quot;receiving party&quot;) may herein, or &#13;&#10;by notice to the other party (a &quot;sending party&quot;), request that &quot;courtesy copies&quot; of any notice given &#13;&#10;by the sending party to the receiving party (&quot;courtesy copies&quot;) also be sent to the receiving party &#13;&#10;by email at the email addresses provided for herein (or at a future email address as shall be &#13;&#10;designated by notice given in accordance in accordance with this Section 17). In the event of such &#13;&#10;a request, the sending party shall endeavor to send courtesy copies as so requested; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that under no circumstances hereunder shall any notice be deemed ineffective, nor shall &#13;&#10;the sending party have any liability to the receiving party, on account of the sending party&#39;s failure &#13;&#10;to send (for whatever reason) or the receiving party&#39;s failure to receive (for whatever reason), any &#13;&#10;courtesy copies, notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein. Notice by telephone &#13;&#10;shall not suffice as a means for giving notice hereunder, the provision of any telephone numbers &#13;&#10;hereinabove being for the parties&#39; convenience only. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18. Termination. Upon the termination of this Lease, by expiration or otherwise, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall surrender the Premises, including without limitation (i) all Improvements located &#13;&#10;therein (except as otherwise expressly provided in clause (ii) below) and (ii) all Alterations made &#13;&#10;thereto and Permanent Fixtures installed therein (except for any Business Installations removed &#13;&#10;in accordance with Section 8(b)), to Landlord in vacant condition, free from all tenants and &#13;&#10;occupants, broom clean, free of all trash and debris and otherwise in the same good order, &#13;&#10;condition and repair in which Tenant is obligated to keep, repair, and maintain the Premises &#13;&#10;throughout the term, excepting only ordinary wear and tear and damage from casualty or &#13;&#10;condemnation that Tenant is not responsible for the repair or restoration of to the extent (if any) &#13;&#10;expressly provided hereunder. All moveable furnishings, trade fixtures and other equipment and &#13;&#10;personal property owned by Tenant, whether or not attached to the Improvements, shall be &#13;&#10;removed from the Premises by Tenant, at Tenant&#39;s sole expense, by no later than the date of &#13;&#10;termination, and Tenant shall repair any and all damage caused by such removal. In the event &#13;&#10;Tenant fails so to remove any thereof or fails to repair any such damage to the Premises or the &#13;&#10;Property, or in the event that Tenant fails to perform any restoration or removal as may be required &#13;&#10;under clause (B) of Section 8(a) above, Landlord may do so and Tenant shall reimburse Landlord &#13;&#10;for the cost of such restoration, removal and repair upon demand. In any event, any trade fixtures, &#13;&#10;equipment, furniture and other personal property of Tenant which remain in the Premises &#13;&#10;following the expiration or earlier termination of the term, at the Landlord&#39;s option, shall be &#13;&#10;deemed abandoned by Tenant and may thereafter be removed and stored at the cost of the Tenant &#13;&#10;or retained as the property of the Landlord or sold or otherwise disposed of by the &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<A NAME="eolPage249"></A>

	&nbsp;

<!-- SLIDE 0155 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023155.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 155" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	25 &#13;&#10;Landlord, in any such case without any liability to or recourse by the Tenant or anyone claiming &#13;&#10;by, through or under the Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;19. Quiet Enjoyment. So long as Tenant shall duly and punctually perform and observe &#13;&#10;all of its obligations under this Lease, Tenant shall peaceably and quietly enjoy the Premises free &#13;&#10;from hindrance by Landlord or any party claiming by, through or under Landlord, subject, &#13;&#10;however, to zoning laws and ordinances, all matters set forth in EXHIBIT D attached hereto (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Permitted Encumbrances&quot;), the REA (as defined herein) and any Project Documents (as defined &#13;&#10;herein). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;20. Holding Over. If Tenant remains in the Premises beyond the expiration of the term &#13;&#10;of this Lease or the earlier termination thereof (as the case may be, &quot;Lease Termination&quot;), such &#13;&#10;holding over shall not be deemed to create any tenancy at will, but Tenant shall be a tenant at &#13;&#10;sufferance only, subject to all of Tenant&#39;s obligations set forth herein except that Base Rent shall &#13;&#10;be payable for Tenant&#39;s use and occupancy at a daily rate as follows: (i) for first 60 days following &#13;&#10;Lease Termination, one hundred fifty percent (150%) of the Base Rent otherwise provided for &#13;&#10;herein; (ii) for the 61st day through the 120th day following Lease Termination, one hundred &#13;&#10;seventy five percent (175%) of the Base Rent otherwise provided for herein; and (iii) from and &#13;&#10;after the 121st day following Lease Termination, two hundred percent (200%) of the Base Rent &#13;&#10;otherwise provided for herein. The acceptance of a purported rent check following termination &#13;&#10;shall not constitute the creation of a tenancy at will, it being agreed that Tenant&#39;s status shall &#13;&#10;remain that of a tenant at sufferance, at the aforesaid daily rate. Any reference in this Lease to &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s obligations continuing during the period of any holdover shall not be deemed to grant &#13;&#10;Tenant the right to a holdover or imply Landlord&#39;s consent to any such holdover. In addition, &#13;&#10;should Tenant remain in the Premises as a holdover Tenant in excess of sixty (60) days beyond &#13;&#10;Lease Termination, Tenant shall indemnify Landlord for, from, and against all costs, claims, &#13;&#10;liabilities and damages arising from or in any manner related to any such holdover including, &#13;&#10;without limitation, damages payable to the subsequent tenant or related to the loss of a tenant, &#13;&#10;notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth elsewhere in this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21. Right of Entry. Landlord shall at all times, upon not less than 24 hours advance &#13;&#10;notice (except in the case of emergencies) and with due regard for Tenant&#39;s reasonable security &#13;&#10;concerns, have the right during Tenant&#39;s regular business hours to re-enter the Premises to inspect &#13;&#10;the same, to supply any service to be provided by Landlord to Tenant hereunder, to show the &#13;&#10;Premises to prospective purchasers, investors, mortgagees or (during the last two (2) years of the &#13;&#10;term) tenants and to post notices of non-responsibility provided that (i) such entry does not &#13;&#10;interfere with Tenant&#39;s business operations in the Premises, (ii) no repair, alterations or &#13;&#10;improvements shall reduce the size of the Premises other than in a de minimis fashion, and (iii) &#13;&#10;Landlord shall be responsible for any injury or damage occasioned to the Premises during such &#13;&#10;entry due to Landlord&#39;s and/or Landlord&#39;s employees, agents and/or contractors negligence or &#13;&#10;willful misconduct. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22. Estoppel Certificates. Landlord and Tenant each agree that at any time and from &#13;&#10;time to time upon not less than fifteen (15) days prior request of the other party, the party of whom &#13;&#10;the request is made shall execute, acknowledge and deliver to the requesting party a statement in &#13;&#10;writing certifying (a) that this Lease is unmodified and in full force and effect (or if there have &#13;&#10;been modifications, specifying the same), (b) the dates to which the rent and other &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	26 &#13;&#10;charges have been paid, (c) that to the knowledge of the party supplying the certificate the other &#13;&#10;party is not in default under any provisions to this Lease (or if such party knows of any such &#13;&#10;default, specifying the same) and (d) such other matters as the requesting party or such party&#39;s &#13;&#10;mortgagee shall reasonably request; it being intended that any such statement may conclusively &#13;&#10;be relied upon by Landlord (if requested by Landlord), Tenant (if requested by Tenant), any &#13;&#10;person proposing to acquire Tenant&#39;s or Landlord&#39;s interest in this Lease or any prospective &#13;&#10;mortgagee of or assignee of any mortgage upon Landlord&#39;s interest, as applicable. Any such &#13;&#10;certification shall be deemed to have been given for good and valuable consideration whether so &#13;&#10;stated or not. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23. Non-Liability of Landlord. Except to the extent occasioned by the negligence or &#13;&#10;willful misconduct of Landlord and/or Landlord&#39;s employees, agents, owners, contractors, &#13;&#10;managers, directors and/or licensees (each, a &quot;Landlord Party&quot;), but in all such cases subject to &#13;&#10;the provisions of Section 9(f), Landlord shall not be liable to Tenant, and Tenant hereby waives &#13;&#10;all claims against Landlord, for any injury or damage to any person or property in or about the &#13;&#10;Premises resulting from the Premises, or any part thereof or any equipment thereof, becoming out &#13;&#10;of repair; flooding of basements or other areas; damages caused by sprinkling devices, air &#13;&#10;conditioning apparatus, snow, frost, water leakage, steam, excessive heat or cold, falling plaster, &#13;&#10;broken glass, sewage, gas, odors or noise or the bursting or leaking of pipes or plumbing fixtures; &#13;&#10;any act or neglect of other tenants or occupants or employees in the Premises; or any other thing &#13;&#10;or circumstance whatsoever concerning the Premises, whether of a like nature or of a wholly &#13;&#10;different nature, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law. All property in or about the &#13;&#10;Premises belonging to Tenant, its agents, employees or invitees shall be there at the risk of Tenant &#13;&#10;or other person only, and Landlord shall not be liable for damage thereto or theft, misappropriation &#13;&#10;or loss thereof unless caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of Landlord (but in all cases &#13;&#10;subject to the provisions of Section 9(f)). If Landlord shall fail to perform any covenant or &#13;&#10;condition of this Lease upon Landlord&#39;s part to be performed and, as a consequence of such default, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall recover a money judgment against Landlord, then such judgment shall be satisfied &#13;&#10;only out of the right, title and interest of Landlord in the Premises and out of rents or other income, &#13;&#10;insurance proceeds, condemnation proceeds, financing or refinancing and/or sale proceeds from &#13;&#10;the Premises receivable by Landlord and Landlord shall not be personally liable for any &#13;&#10;deficiency. In no event shall the members, managers, officers, directors, agents, partners, &#13;&#10;principals, employees and/or shareholders of Landlord have any liability whatsoever for any &#13;&#10;damages and/or liability under this Lease and, subject to all limitations on Landlord&#39;s liability &#13;&#10;contained herein, Tenant will look solely to Landlord for the recovery of any damages or &#13;&#10;otherwise under any terms, covenants or conditions contained in this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24. Transfer by Landlord. In the event of a sale or conveyance by Landlord of the &#13;&#10;Premises, the same shall operate to release Landlord from any future liability upon any of the &#13;&#10;covenants or conditions herein contained which accrue after the date of transfer, and in such event &#13;&#10;Tenant agrees to look solely to the successor in interest of Landlord in and to this Lease, provided, &#13;&#10;further, that the transferee expressly agrees in writing to assume the Landlord&#39;s obligations under &#13;&#10;this Lease. This Lease shall not be affected by any such sale or conveyance, and Tenant agrees to &#13;&#10;attorn to the successor in interest of Landlord in and to this Lease, which successor in interest &#13;&#10;shall be obligated on this Lease only so long as it is the owner of Landlord&#39;s interest in and to this &#13;&#10;Lease. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	27 &#13;&#10;25. No Liens. Except as expressly permitted elsewhere in this Lease without in each &#13;&#10;instance the prior written consent of Landlord, Tenant shall not directly or indirectly create or &#13;&#10;permit to be created or to remain, and will immediately discharge, any lien, encumbrance, or &#13;&#10;charge on, or pledge of, the Premises, or any part thereof, the interest of Tenant hereunder or &#13;&#10;therein, or the rent or other payments hereunder, other than: (a) this Lease; (b) any assignment, &#13;&#10;pledge, lien, encumbrance, charge, conditional sale, or title retention agreement affecting the &#13;&#10;Premises, resulting solely from (i) any action by Landlord or (ii) any liability or obligation of &#13;&#10;Landlord which Tenant is not obligated by this Lease to assume; (c) liens for Taxes not yet &#13;&#10;payable; or (d) liens of mechanics, materialmen, suppliers, or vendors, or rights thereto, incurred &#13;&#10;in the ordinary course of business for sums which under the terms of the related contracts are not &#13;&#10;yet due, provided that such reserve or other appropriate provision, if any, as may be required by &#13;&#10;generally accepted accounting principles shall have been made therefor. In amplification and not &#13;&#10;in limitation of the foregoing, Tenant shall not knowingly permit any portion of the Premises to &#13;&#10;be used by any person or persons or by the public, as such, at any time or times during the term &#13;&#10;of this Lease, in such manner as might tend to impair the title or interest of Landlord in the &#13;&#10;Premises, or any portion thereof, or in such manner as might make possible a claim or claims of &#13;&#10;adverse use, adverse possession, prescription, dedication, or other similar claims of, in, to, or with &#13;&#10;respect to the Premises, or any part thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;26. Net Lease. This Lease is intended to be and shall be an absolute &quot;net, net, net&quot; &#13;&#10;lease, and the rent and all other sums payable hereunder by Tenant (all of which shall be deemed &#13;&#10;to be additional rent) shall be paid without notice or demand and without set-off, counterclaim, &#13;&#10;abatement, suspension, deduction, or defense except to the extent (if any) otherwise expressly set &#13;&#10;forth in this Lease. As more particularly set forth herein, Tenant shall pay all Taxes, insurance &#13;&#10;premiums, maintenance, repair and replacement costs and expenses, utility charges and expenses, &#13;&#10;and all other costs and expenses, of whatever nature, relating in any way to the Premises and/or &#13;&#10;the operation thereof during the term of this Lease except as otherwise expressly provided in this &#13;&#10;Lease. In addition, this Lease shall continue in full force and effect and the obligations of Tenant &#13;&#10;hereunder shall not be released, discharged, diminished, or otherwise affected by reason of any &#13;&#10;damage to or destruction of the Premises, or any part or parts thereof; any partial taking; any &#13;&#10;restriction on or prevention of or interference with any use of the Premises, or any part or parts &#13;&#10;thereof, except to the extent otherwise expressly set forth in this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;27. Environmental Covenants. Tenant shall not produce, use, store, or dispose of any &#13;&#10;toxic or hazardous chemicals, wastes, materials or substances, or any pollutants or contaminants, &#13;&#10;as those terms are defined in any applicable federal, state, local or other governmental law, statute, &#13;&#10;ordinance, code, rule or regulation (&quot;Hazardous Substances&quot;) at, in, on, under or from the &#13;&#10;Premises, except to the extent that such Hazardous Substances are used in or generated in the &#13;&#10;ordinary course of operating and maintaining Tenant&#39;s business on the Premises and are produced, &#13;&#10;stored, used, or disposed of in accordance with all such laws, statutes, ordinances, codes, permits, &#13;&#10;rules and regulations which are applicable to the Premises or the Tenant (&quot;Environmental &#13;&#10;Regulations&quot;) and except that certain non-friable asbestos in good condition or asbestos which &#13;&#10;has been encapsulated in accordance with applicable Environmental Regulations may remain on &#13;&#10;the Premises. Tenant shall not allow any Hazardous Substance to be emitted, discharged, released, &#13;&#10;spilled or deposited from, in or on the Premises during the term of this Lease as a result of the act &#13;&#10;or omission of Tenant or any Tenant Responsible Party. In addition, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	28 &#13;&#10;Tenant shall use commercially reasonable efforts to not allow any Hazardous Substance to be &#13;&#10;emitted, discharged, released, spilled or deposited from, in or on the Premises during the term of &#13;&#10;this Lease as a result of the act or omission of any parties other than Tenant or a Tenant &#13;&#10;Responsible Party. In the event of a release of Hazardous Substances during the term of this Lease &#13;&#10;(other than as allowed by Environmental Regulations), Tenant shall upon becoming aware of the &#13;&#10;same (a) report such release to the applicable governmental authority in accordance with &#13;&#10;applicable Environmental Regulations, and to Landlord within five (5) business days, (b) remove &#13;&#10;and remediate such release as required by Environmental Regulations and (c) promptly provide &#13;&#10;Landlord with any reports or other documentation related to its response to any such release, &#13;&#10;except that to the extent that any such release is caused by the negligence or willful act of a &#13;&#10;Landlord Party then Tenant&#39;s only obligation under this sentence is to notify Landlord thereof &#13;&#10;under clause (a). If at any time Tenant receives a notice of violation, order, information request or &#13;&#10;demand from an agency with jurisdiction over the Premises (as the case may be, an &quot;NOV&quot;), &#13;&#10;Tenant shall notify Landlord within thirty (30) days of receipt that such NOV has been received &#13;&#10;and Tenant shall respond to the NOV within the time period required by Environmental &#13;&#10;Regulations. During the term of this Lease, Tenant shall obtain and maintain, or register under, as &#13;&#10;applicable, all licenses and permits required by any Environmental Regulation. Tenant shall, in &#13;&#10;accordance with Environmental Regulations, maintain all safety data sheets with respect to &#13;&#10;Hazardous Substances stored or used by Tenant, and upon request by Landlord, Tenant shall &#13;&#10;promptly provide a copy of such safety data sheets to Landlord. Landlord upon at least twenty &#13;&#10;four (24) hours prior written notice to Tenant shall have the right to enter the Premises to inspect &#13;&#10;the same for compliance with the provisions of this Section 27. Tenant agrees to indemnify &#13;&#10;Landlord against, and to hold Landlord harmless from, any and all claims, demands, judgments, &#13;&#10;fines, penalties, costs, damages and expenses, including court costs and reasonable attorneys, fees &#13;&#10;in any suit, action administrative proceeding or negotiations resulting therefrom, and including &#13;&#10;costs of investigation, remediation, clean-up and/or monitoring of the Premises and the &#13;&#10;environment (&quot;Environmental Claims&quot;), resulting from (i) the presence or release of any &#13;&#10;Hazardous Substances at the Premises that first occurs prior to the term of this Lease and resulted &#13;&#10;from the acts or omissions of Tenant or any Tenant Responsible Party (as the case may be, &quot;Tenant &#13;&#10;Entities&quot;), or (ii) the presence or release of any Hazardous Substances at the Premises that first &#13;&#10;occurs during the term of this Lease (including any holdover period) except to the extent caused &#13;&#10;by the negligence or willful act of a Landlord Party, in either case (i) or (ii) regardless of whether &#13;&#10;or not the release or presence of such Hazardous Substances is a result of a violation by Tenant or &#13;&#10;any Tenant Entities of this Section 27 or of any Environmental Regulation, to the fullest extent &#13;&#10;permitted by applicable law. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord shall defend, indemnify &#13;&#10;and hold harmless the Tenant and any Tenant Entities from any Environmental Claims to the &#13;&#10;extent resulting from the negligence or willful act of Landlord and/or its agents, employees, &#13;&#10;contractors, vendors, and invitees including but not limited to any exacerbation of any existing &#13;&#10;conditions caused by the negligence or willful act of Landlord and/or its employees, contractors, &#13;&#10;vendors and invitees (as the case may be, &quot;Landlord Entities&quot;). The parties acknowledge that &#13;&#10;Tenant or one or more Tenant Responsible Parties have been in possession or control of the Leased &#13;&#10;Parcel prior to Effective Date and that under no circumstances whatsoever shall Landlord have &#13;&#10;any liability to Tenant on account of any condition existing on or about the Leased Parcel on the &#13;&#10;Effective Date or otherwise existing due to the act or omission of Tenant or any Tenant &#13;&#10;Responsible Parties. As used herein, &quot;Tenant Responsible Party&quot; shall mean, with respect to &#13;&#10;Tenant, any present or former officer, director, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
