	29 &#13;&#10;stockholder, member, manager, partner, affiliate, parent or subsidiary (whether direct or indirect), &#13;&#10;agent, employee, contractor, vendor, invitee, subtenant, licensee or other party for whose conduct &#13;&#10;Tenant may be legally responsible. Representations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Landlord represents and warrants to Tenant as of the Effective Date that &#13;&#10;(i) Landlord has the power and authority to execute and deliver this Lease and to comply with all &#13;&#10;the provisions of this Lease, (ii) the performance by Landlord of Landlord&#39;s duties and obligations &#13;&#10;under this Lease and of all other acts necessary and appropriate for the full consummation of the &#13;&#10;lease of the Leased Parcel under this Lease are consistent with and not in violation of, and will &#13;&#10;not create any adverse condition under, any contract, agreement or other instrument to which &#13;&#10;Landlord is a party, or any judicial order or judgment of any nature by which Landlord is bound, &#13;&#10;and (iii) there is no action, suit or proceeding pending or, to Landlord&#39;s actual knowledge, &#13;&#10;threatened by or against or affecting Landlord which does or will involve or affect the Leased &#13;&#10;Parcel or Landlord&#39;s title thereto, or Landlord&#39;s ability to perform its obligations under this Lease &#13;&#10;or any documents entered into pursuant to this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Tenant represents and warrants to Tenant as of the Effective Date that (i) &#13;&#10;Tenant has the power and authority to execute and deliver this Lease and to comply with all the &#13;&#10;provisions of this Lease, (ii) the performance by Tenant of Tenant&#39;s duties and obligations under &#13;&#10;this Lease and of all other acts necessary and appropriate for the full consummation of the lease &#13;&#10;of the Leased Parcel under this Lease are consistent with and not in violation of, and will not &#13;&#10;create any adverse condition under, any contract, agreement or other instrument to which Tenant &#13;&#10;is a party, or any judicial order or judgement of any nature by which Tenant is bound, and (iii) &#13;&#10;there is no action, suit or proceeding pending or, to Tenant&#39;s actual knowledge, threatened by or &#13;&#10;against or affecting Tenant which does or will involve or affect the Leased Parcel or Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;interests under this Lease, or Tenant&#39;s ability to perform its obligation under this Lease or any &#13;&#10;documents entered into pursuant to this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29. Execution. The submission of this document for examination does not constitute &#13;&#10;an offer to lease, or a reservation of, or option for, the Premises and this document becomes &#13;&#10;effective and binding only upon the execution and delivery hereof by both Landlord and Tenant. &#13;&#10;Tenant confirms that Landlord has made no representations or promises with respect to the &#13;&#10;Premises or the making or entry into of this Lease except as are expressly set forth herein, and &#13;&#10;agrees that no claim or liability shall be asserted by Tenant against Landlord for, and Landlord &#13;&#10;shall not be liable by reason of breach of any representations or promises not expressly stated in &#13;&#10;this Lease. This Lease can be modified or altered only by agreement in writing between Landlord &#13;&#10;and Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;30. Binding Effect. The covenants, agreements and obligations herein contained, &#13;&#10;except as herein otherwise specifically provided, shall extend to, bind and inure to the benefit of &#13;&#10;the parties here to and their respective personal representatives, heirs, successors and assigns of &#13;&#10;Tenant (but in the case of assigns only to the extent that assignment is permitted hereunder). No &#13;&#10;third party, other than such successors and assigns, shall be entitled to enforce any or all of the &#13;&#10;terms of this Lease or shall have rights hereunder whatsoever. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	30 &#13;&#10;31. Signs. Tenant may, at its sole cost and expense and without the necessity of obtaining &#13;&#10;the consent of Landlord, prepare, install, affix or use any signs or other advertising or identifying media &#13;&#10;on or about the exterior of the Premises identifying any occupants of the Premises or their respective &#13;&#10;businesses, provided that in no event shall such signage adversely affect the structural integrity of &#13;&#10;the Improvements, and provided further, that Tenant shall comply with any and all governmental &#13;&#10;laws, regulations, ordinances and rules and all recorded restrictions and covenants. Tenant shall &#13;&#10;indemnify and hold Landlord harmless from all claims, losses, liabilities, damages and expenses &#13;&#10;(including reasonable attorney&#39;s fees) resulting from the installation of any signs or other advertising &#13;&#10;or identifying media pursuant to this Section 31. Upon the termination of this Lease, by expiration &#13;&#10;or otherwise, Tenant shall remove any and all signs or other advertising or identifying media installed &#13;&#10;by Tenant and Tenant shall repair any damage as a result of such removal. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;32. Interpretation. The laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts shall govern the &#13;&#10;validity, performance and enforcement of this Lease. The invalidity or unenforceability of any &#13;&#10;provision of this Lease shall not affect or impair any other provision. Whenever the singular &#13;&#10;number is used, the same shall include the plural, and the masculine gender shall include the &#13;&#10;feminine and neuter genders. The captions appearing in this Lease are inserted only as a matter of &#13;&#10;convenience and in no way define, limit, construe or describe the scope or intent of such sections &#13;&#10;or paragraphs of this Lease nor in any way affect this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;33. Force Majeure. In the event that Landlord or Tenant shall be delayed or hindered &#13;&#10;in or prevented from the performance of any act required hereunder by reason of strikes, lockouts, &#13;&#10;labor troubles, inability to procure materials, failure of power, restrictive governmental laws, &#13;&#10;regulations, orders or decrees, riots, insurrection, war, acts of God, inclement weather, or other &#13;&#10;reason beyond such party&#39;s reasonable control, then performance of such act shall be excused for &#13;&#10;the period of the delay and the period for the performance of any such act shall be extended for a &#13;&#10;period equivalent to the period of such delay; provided that nothing contained in this Section 33 &#13;&#10;shall excuse, delay or otherwise apply to the Tenant&#39;s obligation to pay rent or perform any other &#13;&#10;monetary obligation hereunder or to any deadline set forth herein for a party to give the other party &#13;&#10;any notice expressly provided for herein. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;34. Corporate Authority. If Tenant is a corporation, each individual executing this &#13;&#10;Lease on behalf of said corporation represents and warrants that he or she is duly authorized to &#13;&#10;execute and deliver this Lease on behalf of said corporation, in accordance with a duly adopted &#13;&#10;resolution of the board of directors of said corporation, and that this Lease is binding upon said &#13;&#10;corporation in accordance with its terms. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;35. Project/Other Documents. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) The parties acknowledge that, pursuant to the 144 Chelmsford Lease, &#13;&#10;Landlord will have certain obligations to pursue such governmental permits and approvals and &#13;&#10;take such other actions as shall be reasonably necessary in order for Landlord to (x) divide the &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s Parcel into separate units of ownership for the Leased Parcel and for the 144 &#13;&#10;Chelmsford Parcel and (y) construct an approximately 59,000 square foot building with related &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	31 &#13;&#10;site improvements on the 144 Chelmsford Parcel. Tenant acknowledges that in so doing it may &#13;&#10;become necessary for Landlord to (I) adjust the exact location of the lot line separating the Leased &#13;&#10;Parcel and the 144 Chelmsford Parcel and/or the relative size of the Leased Parcel and the 144 &#13;&#10;Chelmsford Parcel, (II) increase, decrease or change certain site improvements or common &#13;&#10;facilities located on the Leased Parcel or the 144 Chelmsford Parcel, (III) agree to certain &#13;&#10;conditions imposed by governmental authorities that will affect the Landlord&#39;s Parcel, &#13;&#10;(IV) grant or secure easements and/or other agreements with one or more third parties that will &#13;&#10;affect the Leased Parcel or (V) modify the REA or other Permitted Encumbrances in a manner &#13;&#10;that will affect the Leased Parcel (all of the foregoing being &quot;Project Requirements&quot;), such Project &#13;&#10;Requirements to be governed by one or more documents effecting the same (&quot;Project &#13;&#10;Documents&quot;). Landlord reserves the right to implement any Project Requirements, and to enter &#13;&#10;into any Project Documents and deem the same to be Permitted Encumbrances, subject to Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;approval not to be unreasonably withheld conditioned or delayed, and Tenant agrees to execute &#13;&#10;any reasonable modifications of this Lease which may be required from time to time in order to &#13;&#10;effect any of the same; provided, however, that (A) no such Project Requirements or Project &#13;&#10;Documents shall alter the term of this Lease provided herein, increase the rent provided herein, &#13;&#10;reduce the economic value to Tenant hereof, change in any manner any of the relative rights or &#13;&#10;obligations or Tenant or Landlord hereunder, or require Tenant to incur any out-of pocket cost &#13;&#10;or adversely affect or increase the cost of Tenant&#39;s business operations at the Building and/or the &#13;&#10;Premises and (B) all such Project Requirements or Project Documents shall be authorized or &#13;&#10;required to be implemented pursuant to the terms of the 144 Chelmsford Lease. Any dispute under &#13;&#10;the provisions of this subsection 35(a)(i) shall be resolved exclusively by Arbitration. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) For the avoidance of doubt, the parties acknowledge that under no &#13;&#10;circumstances (x) shall Landlord have any liability to Tenant under this Lease on account of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s acts or omissions in violation of any of its obligations under the 144 Chelmsford Lease &#13;&#10;or (y) shall Tenant have any liability to Landlord under this Lease on account of Tenant&#39;s acts or &#13;&#10;omissions in violation of any of its obligations under the 144 Chelmsford Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Other Documents. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Reference is made to a certain Reciprocal Easement Agreement of &#13;&#10;even date herewith being entered into and recorded with the Middlesex North Registry of Deeds &#13;&#10;and filed with the Middlesex Registry District of the Land Court concurrently with the execution &#13;&#10;and delivery of this Lease (the &quot;REA&quot;). Capitalized terms used in this Section 35(b) and not &#13;&#10;specifically defined in this Lease shall have the respective meanings assigned them under the &#13;&#10;REA. Tenant is hereby designated as the Major Tenant of the 100 Property. Subject to all of the &#13;&#10;terms and conditions set forth in this Lease and in the REA, Tenant shall have the following rights &#13;&#10;during the term of this Lease (which rights shall be deemed included in the Ancillary Rights): &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. all easements granted to the 100 Owner under the REA, in &#13;&#10;common with the 100 Owner, and others now or hereafter &#13;&#10;entitled thereto in accordance with the terms of the REA; &#13;&#10;and &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	32 &#13;&#10;B. all rights reserved by the I 00 Owner on the I 00 Property in &#13;&#10;connection with the 100 Owner&#39;s granting to others of &#13;&#10;easements in the 144 Property pursuant to the REA, in common &#13;&#10;with the 144 Owner. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) During the term of this Lease, Tenant shall, on Landlord&#39;s behalf, &#13;&#10;pay, perform and observe in a timely manner all of the obligations of Landlord under the REA, &#13;&#10;any Permitted Encumbrances or any Project Documents (each, an &quot;Other Document&quot;) insofar as &#13;&#10;they pertain to Tenant&#39;s (a) use or occupancy of the Premises, (b) exercise or enjoyment of any of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s rights under this Lease, or (c) compliance with any of Tenant&#39;s obligations under this &#13;&#10;Lease (collectively, &quot;Lease Matters&quot;); provided that such Lease Matters shall in no event be &#13;&#10;deemed to include (x) any obligation of Landlord under any Other Document that is an obligation &#13;&#10;of Landlord to Tenant as expressly set forth in this Lease or (y) any liability to the extent caused &#13;&#10;by the negligence or willful act of Landlord. Tenant shall, from time to time upon the reasonable &#13;&#10;request by Landlord, provide reasonable evidence of Tenant&#39;s compliance with the terms of the &#13;&#10;preceding sentence (with respect to any specific obligations of Tenant thereunder). In any event, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall not cause, suffer or permit any act or omission on or about the Premises or otherwise &#13;&#10;in connection with any Lease Matters that would cause Landlord to be in violation (a &quot;Violation&quot;) &#13;&#10;of any of the Other Documents. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) Landlord shall (A) perform and observe all of the terms, covenants, &#13;&#10;provisions and conditions of any Other Documents on Landlord&#39;s part to be performed and &#13;&#10;observed pursuant to the terms thereof, except for such obligations as are Tenant&#39;s responsibility &#13;&#10;as set forth above, and (B) enforce the obligations of the other parties to any of the Other &#13;&#10;Documents (an &quot;Other Party&quot;), in each case to the extent necessary for Landlord to comply with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s obligations to Tenant under this Lease. In no event whatsoever shall either party hereto &#13;&#10;have any liability to the other on account of (x) any Other Party&#39;s failure to keep, observe or &#13;&#10;perform its obligations pursuant to the Other Document or (y) the acts or omissions of any Other &#13;&#10;Party, its agents, employees, invitees, guests, licenses or contractors. &#13;&#10;(iv) In any case where Tenant shall request Landlord&#39;s consent, &#13;&#10;permission or approval for any matter requiring Landlord&#39;s consent, permission or approval as set &#13;&#10;forth in this Lease (a &quot;Consent Request&quot;) then, to the extent that such matter shall also require the &#13;&#10;consent, permission or approval of an Other Owner, other than a Landlord Affiliate, under an &#13;&#10;Other Document (an &quot;Other Owner Consent&quot;), Landlord shall have no obligation to act upon the &#13;&#10;Consent Request unless and until such time as the Other Owner Consent shall have been given. &#13;&#10;Upon Landlord&#39;s reasonable determination that the Consent Request is complete and in proper &#13;&#10;form for consideration under both this Lease and the Other Document, Landlord shall request the &#13;&#10;Other Owner Consent in accordance with the Other Document and thereafter use commercially &#13;&#10;reasonable efforts in accordance with the Other Document to obtain the Other Owner Consent. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to the contrary contained herein, any Consent Request &#13;&#10;to Landlord shall also be deemed to have been made to any Landlord Affiliate that is an Other &#13;&#10;Owner. As used herein, &quot;Landlord Affiliate&quot; shall mean Landlord and/or a party that controls, is &#13;&#10;controlled by, or is under common control with Landlord. &#13;&#10;(v) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth above in this &#13;&#10;Section 35(b), Landlord may by notice to Tenant require, in lieu of Landlord&#39;s taking any direct &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	33 &#13;&#10;action with respect to any Other Party or Other Document as set forth above in this Section 35(b), &#13;&#10;that Tenant, at Tenant&#39;s sole cost and expense (except to the extent that the action is required as a &#13;&#10;result of Landlord&#39;s failure to have performed an obligation of Landlord under this Lease), take &#13;&#10;such action on Landlord&#39;s behalf and in its name and, for purposes thereof, Tenant shall be deemed &#13;&#10;subrogated to Landlord&#39;s rights under the Other Document to take such action. In taking any such &#13;&#10;action, Tenant shall have the right, but not the obligation, to exercise any or all rights and remedies &#13;&#10;as would be available to Landlord, at law or in equity, were Landlord to take the action directly. &#13;&#10;Landlord agrees to sign, to the extent Landlord&#39;s signature is legally required or required under &#13;&#10;the provisions of the Other Document, such demands, pleadings, and/or other documents that may &#13;&#10;be reasonably required, and otherwise to enable Tenant to proceed as set forth above in this &#13;&#10;subsection (v). In the event Landlord exercises its rights under this subsection (v), Tenant shall &#13;&#10;provide Landlord with copies of all written notices, demands, communications and &#13;&#10;correspondence of a material nature sent or received by Tenant in connection therewith, &#13;&#10;simultaneously with their sending by Tenant or promptly upon their receipt by Tenant. &#13;&#10;36. Miscellaneous. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Consent not a Waiver. The consent or approval by Landlord to or of any &#13;&#10;act by Tenant requiring Landlord&#39;s consent or approval shall not be deemed to render unnecessary &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s consent or approval to or of any subsequent similar act by Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Entire Agreement. This Lease and the exhibits and rider, if any, attached &#13;&#10;hereto and forming a part hereof, set forth all the covenants, promises, agreements, conditions and &#13;&#10;understandings between Landlord and Tenant concerning the Premises and there are no covenants, &#13;&#10;promises, agreements, conditions or understandings, either oral or written, between them other &#13;&#10;than are herein set forth. No alteration, amendment, change or addition to this Lease shall be &#13;&#10;binding upon Landlord or Tenant unless reduced to writing and signed by each party. The &#13;&#10;invalidity of one or more phrases, clauses, sentences, Sections contained in this Lease shall not &#13;&#10;affect the remaining portions of this Lease or any part thereof, and if any one or more of the &#13;&#10;phrases, clauses, sentences, Sections contained in this Lease should be declared invalid by the &#13;&#10;final order, decree or judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction, including all appeals &#13;&#10;therefrom, this Lease shall be construed as if such invalid phrases, clauses, sentences, Sections or &#13;&#10;had not been inserted in this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Independent Covenants. Tenant waives all rights to (i) any abatement, &#13;&#10;suspension, deferment, reduction or deduction of or from rent, and/or (ii) quit, terminate or &#13;&#10;surrender this Lease or the Premises or any part thereof, except, in either case, as expressly &#13;&#10;provided herein. Tenant hereby acknowledges and agrees that the obligations of Tenant hereunder &#13;&#10;shall be separate and independent covenants and agreements, that rent shall continue to be payable &#13;&#10;in all events and that the obligations of Tenant hereunder shall continue unaffected, unless the &#13;&#10;requirement to pay or perform the same shall have been terminated pursuant to an express &#13;&#10;provision of this Lease. Tenant agrees that Tenant shall not take any action to terminate, to rescind &#13;&#10;or to avoid this Lease notwithstanding any default by Landlord hereunder except as a consequence &#13;&#10;of Landlord&#39;s breach of its obligations under the first sentence of Section 19 or except to the extent &#13;&#10;(if any) expressly set forth herein. Landlord and Tenant each acknowledges and agrees that the &#13;&#10;independent nature of the obligations of Tenant and Landlord hereunder &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	34 &#13;&#10;represents fair, reasonable and accepted commercial practice with respect to the type of property &#13;&#10;subject to this Lease, and that this agreement is the product of free and informed negotiation &#13;&#10;during which both Landlord and Tenant were represented by counsel skilled in negotiating and &#13;&#10;drafting commercial leases in Massachusetts and that the acknowledgements and agreements &#13;&#10;contained herein are made with full knowledge of the holding in Wesson v. Leone Enterprises, &#13;&#10;Inc., 437 Mass. 708 (2002). Such acknowledgements, agreements and waivers by Tenant are a &#13;&#10;material inducement to Landlord entering into this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Arbitration. As set forth only in Sections 35(a) and Section 36(r) hereof, &#13;&#10;the parties have agreed to resolve certain disputes by arbitration in accordance with the Expedited &#13;&#10;Arbitration Procedures provisions of the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American &#13;&#10;Arbitration Association (or another arbitration company mutually acceptable to Landlord and &#13;&#10;Tenant) and otherwise under the terms of this subsection 36(d) (&quot;Arbitration&quot;). Any such &#13;&#10;Arbitration shall occur in a location mutually convenient to Landlord and Tenant (or, if Landlord &#13;&#10;and Tenant cannot agree on a mutually convenient location, in the City of Boston, Massachusetts). &#13;&#10;The decision of the arbitrator shall be final, conclusive and binding on the parties, but the arbitrator &#13;&#10;shall have no power to reform, supplement or modify this Lease. The arbitrator shall make &#13;&#10;required findings incident to an arbitrable dispute, which findings shall be set forth in reasonable &#13;&#10;detail in a written decision by the arbitrator. Unless otherwise expressly provided hereunder, the &#13;&#10;parties shall share equally in all costs charged by the arbitrator or the arbitration company and &#13;&#10;each party shall otherwise bear its own costs (including attorneys&#39; fees) of any Arbitration. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing, except as otherwise expressly provided in this Lease (but outside &#13;&#10;of this subsection 36(d)), the arbitrator may (but shall not be obligated to), in its sole discretion, &#13;&#10;determine the prevailing party in any such Arbitration and award such prevailing party all of the &#13;&#10;prevailing party&#39;s costs and expenses incurred in connection with the Arbitration (including &#13;&#10;without limitation attorneys&#39; fees and costs). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Accord and Satisfaction. No payment by Tenant or receipt by Landlord of &#13;&#10;a lesser amount than the monthly or any other rent or charge herein stipulated shall be deemed to &#13;&#10;be other than on account, nor shall any endorsement or statement on any check or any letter &#13;&#10;accompanying any check or payment of any rent or charge be deemed an accord and satisfaction, &#13;&#10;and Landlord may accept such check or payment without prejudice to Landlord&#39;s right to recover &#13;&#10;the balance of such rent or charge or pursue any other remedy in this Lease provided. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) No Agency. Nothing contained in this Lease shall be taken or construed to &#13;&#10;create any agency between Landlord and Tenant or to authorize the Tenant to do any act or thing &#13;&#10;or to make any contract so as to encumber in any manner the title of the Landlord to the Premises &#13;&#10;or to create any claim or lien upon the interest of the Landlord in the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(g) Memorandum of Lease. Landlord and Tenant shall, upon request of either &#13;&#10;party, execute and record a notice of this lease in the form attached hereto as EXHIBIT E; &#13;&#10;provided that the party requesting the memorandum shall pay all recording and state, county and &#13;&#10;local transfer fees and/or taxes imposed as a result of such notice. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(h) Financial Statements. Except with respect to any such time as Tenant is a &#13;&#10;corporation whose shares are traded on a US public securities exchange, Tenant shall within 30 &#13;&#10;days after receipt of written request from Landlord but, so long as no Event of Default exists, not &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	35 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;more frequently than once within any twelve-month period, provide to Landlord, for the benefit &#13;&#10;of Landlord, Landlord&#39;s mortgagee and any prospective investors, mortgagee or purchaser of the &#13;&#10;Premises (i) a balance sheet and profit and loss statement of Tenant for Tenant&#39;s most recent fiscal &#13;&#10;year, and (ii) a detailed operating statement of the Premises for the most recent calendar year &#13;&#10;(collectively, &quot;Financial Statements&quot;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Confidentiality. The parties acknowledge that the specific terms and &#13;&#10;conditions of this Lease and any documents made available to Landlord by Tenant hereunder are &#13;&#10;of a confidential nature and shall not be disclosed except to Tenant&#39;s or Landlord&#39;s respective &#13;&#10;affiliates, officers, directors, principals, members, employees, agents, attorneys, partners, &#13;&#10;accountants, lenders (existing or prospective), investors (existing or prospective) or prospective &#13;&#10;purchasers (collectively, for purposes of this Section 36, the &quot;Permitted Outside Parties&quot;) or as &#13;&#10;required by law. No party, including Permitted Outside Parties, shall make any public disclosure &#13;&#10;of the specific terms of this Lease or of any of such documents, except as required by law &#13;&#10;(including SEC regulations and NYSE or NASDAQ requirements). Except as &#13;&#10;required by applicable law, neither party shall issue any press release or make any statement to &#13;&#10;the media regarding the execution and delivery of this Lease without the other party&#39;s consent, &#13;&#10;which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. The provisions of this Section shall &#13;&#10;survive any termination of this Agreement. The terms of this Section 36(i) shall not apply to any &#13;&#10;information that is or becomes publicly known other than through a party&#39;s breach of its &#13;&#10;obligations under this Section 36(i). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(j) Counterparts. This Lease may be executed in any number of counterparts, each &#13;&#10;of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall constitute but one in the &#13;&#10;same instrument. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(k) Time of the Essence. Time is of the essence with respect to every provision &#13;&#10;of this Lease providing for performance, action or inaction by a specified date or within a specified &#13;&#10;period of time. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(1) Survival of Obligations. Any obligations of Tenant occurring prior to the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination of this Lease shall survive such expiration or earlier termination. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(m) Broker. Landlord and Tenant each covenant that they have not dealt with &#13;&#10;any real estate broker, finder or other such party entitled to be paid a fee or a commission with &#13;&#10;respect to this Lease, except for Mark Mulvey of Cushman &amp; Wakefield (&quot;Broker&quot;), whose fees &#13;&#10;shall be payable by Landlord pursuant to a separate written agreement between Landlord and &#13;&#10;Broker. Except for the Broker, each party shall indemnify and hold the other party harmless from &#13;&#10;all damages, claims, liabilities or expenses, including reasonable attorneys&#39; fees, resulting from &#13;&#10;any claims that may be asserted against the other party by any real estate broker or finder with &#13;&#10;whom the indemnifying party either has or is purported to have dealt. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	36 &#13;&#10;(n) Waiver of Jury Trial. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY &#13;&#10;LAW, LANDLORD AND TENANT EACH WAIVE THE RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN &#13;&#10;ANY LITIGATION ARISING OUT OF OR WITH RESPECT TO THIS LEASE. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(o) OFAC. Tenant and Landlord hereby represents and warrants to each other &#13;&#10;that for itself it is not, nor will it become, a person or entity with whom U.S. persons or entities &#13;&#10;are restricted from doing business under regulations of the Office of Foreign Asset Control of the &#13;&#10;Department of the Treasury (including those named on OFAC&#39;s Specially Designated and Blocked &#13;&#10;Persons List) or under any statute, executive order (including the September 24, 2001, Executive &#13;&#10;Order Blocking Property and Prohibiting Transactions with Persons Who Commit, Threaten to &#13;&#10;Commit, or Support Terrorism), or other governmental action. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(p) REIT/UBTI. The Landlord and the Tenant hereby agree that it is their intent &#13;&#10;that all Base Rent, and all other additional rent and any other rent and charges payable to the &#13;&#10;Landlord under this Lease shall qualify as &quot;rents from real property&quot; within the meaning of &#13;&#10;Sections 512(b)(3) and 856(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, (the &quot;Code&quot;) &#13;&#10;and the U.S. Department of the Treasury Regulations promulgated thereunder (the &quot;Regulations&quot;). &#13;&#10;In the event that (i) the Code or the Regulations, or interpretations thereof by the Internal Revenue &#13;&#10;Service contained in revenue rulings or other similar public pronouncements, shall be changed so &#13;&#10;that any rent no longer so qualifies as &quot;rent from real property&quot; for purposes of either said Section &#13;&#10;512(b)(3) or Section 856(d) or (ii) the Landlord, in its sole discretion, determines that there is any &#13;&#10;risk that all or part of any rent shall not qualify as &quot;rents from real property&quot; for the purposes of &#13;&#10;either said Sections 512(b)(3) or 856(d), such rent shall be adjusted in such manner as the Landlord &#13;&#10;may reasonably require so that it will so qualify; provided, however, that any adjustments required &#13;&#10;pursuant to this Section 36(p) shall be made so as to produce the equivalent (in economic terms) &#13;&#10;rent as payable prior to such adjustment. The parties agree to execute such further commercially &#13;&#10;reasonable instrument as may reasonably be required by the Landlord in order to give effect to the &#13;&#10;foregoing provisions of this Section 36(p). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(q) Activity and Use Limitation. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary &#13;&#10;contained herein, Tenant and Landlord acknowledge that the Landlord&#39;s Parcel (including without &#13;&#10;limitation the Premises) is subject to an Activity and Use Limitation (the &quot;Existing AUL&quot;) &#13;&#10;pursuant to the terms of Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 21E, recorded with the Middlesex &#13;&#10;North Registry of Deeds at Book 21997, Page 35, a copy of which has been provided to Tenant. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Tenant and Landlord acknowledge &#13;&#10;that all of Tenant&#39;s and Landlord&#39;s rights and interests under this Lease are subject to the Existing &#13;&#10;AUL and under no circumstances shall Tenant and/or Landlord make any use of the Premises or &#13;&#10;conduct any activity thereon that is prohibited by the Existing AUL. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(r) Limited Sale Profit Participation Right. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(1) Upon a Sale for which (a) the closing (the &quot;Closing,&quot; with the date &#13;&#10;of Closing being the &quot;Closing Date&quot;) occurs prior to the earlier to occur of the third (3rd) &#13;&#10;anniversary of the Commencement Date or an Exempt Sale and (b) the applicable Net Sale &#13;&#10;Proceeds are at least equal to the applicable IRR Amount as of the Closing Date, if this Lease is &#13;&#10;then in full force and effect Landlord shall pay to Tenant the applicable Profit Share Amount &#13;&#10;simultaneously with the Closing Date. As used herein: &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	37 &#13;&#10;&quot;Acquisition&quot; means the acquisition by Landlord and/or a Landlord Affiliate of the Leased Parcel &#13;&#10;and/or the 144 Chelmsford Parcel in connection with the execution and delivery of this Lease. &#13;&#10;&quot;Acquisition Costs&quot; means, as applicable: &#13;&#10;A. if the Subdivision shall not have occurred, the Purchase Price plus the Transaction &#13;&#10;Costs for the Acquisition; or &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. if the Subdivision shall have occurred, the Purchase Price plus the Transaction &#13;&#10;Costs for the Acquisition, multiplied by 66.67%. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Development Costs&quot; means, with respect to any or all hard and soft costs or expenses of &#13;&#10;subdividing, developing and improving the Leased Parcel and/or the 144 &#13;&#10;Chelmsford Parcel (and/or any respective appurtenances), including without &#13;&#10;limitation development, architectural, engineering, project management, &#13;&#10;permitting and legal costs, costs of environmental remediation and costs of &#13;&#10;construction and site work, as applicable: &#13;&#10;A. if the Subdivision shall not have occurred, all such costs or expenses; or &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. if the Subdivision shall have occurred, all such Costs or expenses as shall be &#13;&#10;equitably allocable to the Leased Parcel (with costs and expenses that benefit both &#13;&#10;the Leased Parcel and the 144 Chelmsford Parcel being generally allocated on the &#13;&#10;basis of the amount of relative gross building square footage then built or intended &#13;&#10;to be built for the respective parcels). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Investment&quot; means, as applicable: &#13;&#10;A. if the Subdivision shall not have occurred, the aggregate of the Acquisition Costs &#13;&#10;and Development Costs for the Leased Parcel and the 144 Chelmsford Parcel; or &#13;&#10;B. if the Subdivision shall have occurred, the aggregate of the Acquisition Costs and &#13;&#10;Development Costs for the Leased Parcel. &#13;&#10;&quot;IRR Amount&quot; means an internal rate ofreturn of 10% per annum, compounded annually, on the &#13;&#10;sum of the aggregate applicable Investment of the Landlord and/or its affiliates, commencing on &#13;&#10;the date that any applicable Investment is made (with such internal rate of return to be calculated &#13;&#10;using the XIRR Function of Microsoft Excel). &#13;&#10;&quot;Net Sale Proceeds&quot; means the proceeds of the Sale received by Landlord at the Closing net of &#13;&#10;the aggregate of the applicable Transaction Costs for the Sale. &#13;&#10;&quot;Profit Share Amount&quot; means twenty percent (20%) of the difference between (i) the applicable &#13;&#10;Net Sale Proceeds and (ii) the applicable IRR Amount. &#13;&#10;&quot;Purchase Price&quot; means four million two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($4,250,000). &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage262"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0168 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023168.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 168" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	38 &#13;&#10;&quot;Sale&quot; means a sale or transfer of Landlord&#39;s fee simple interest in the Leased Parcel and, if the &#13;&#10;Subdivision shall not have occurred, the 144 Chelmsford Parcel. Without limitation, a &quot;Sale&quot; shall &#13;&#10;not include (i) the granting of a mortgage or a sale or transfer in connection with a foreclosure of a &#13;&#10;mortgage or by deed in lieu of foreclosure (together with any sale or transfer under clause (iii) &#13;&#10;immediately below, an &quot;Exempt Sale&quot;); (ii) a sale or transfer of Landlord&#39;s interest to a Landlord &#13;&#10;Affiliate, or by descent or devise following the death of any person comprising Landlord, or in &#13;&#10;connection with a merger or sale of all or substantially all of Landlord&#39;s assets, or otherwise by &#13;&#10;operation of law; or (iii) a sale or transfer of Landlord&#39;s interest as part of a transaction by Landlord &#13;&#10;and/or any Landlord Affiliates that also includes at least two (2) properties outside of the 144 &#13;&#10;Chelmsford Parcel, the Leased Parcel or the Hale Property (as defined in the REA); provided that in &#13;&#10;the event of the occurrence of any of the foregoing events other than an Exempt Sale, the provision &#13;&#10;of this Section 36(r) shall continue in full force and effect with respect to any subsequent Sale. &#13;&#10;&quot;Subdivision&quot; means the division of the Landlord&#39;s Parcel into separate legal lots comprised of &#13;&#10;the Leased Parcel and the 144 Chelmsford Parcel. &#13;&#10;&quot;Transaction Costs&quot; means, with respect to the Acquisition or Sale, as applicable, any or all actual &#13;&#10;and reasonable or necessary costs or expenses of consummating the particular transaction incurred &#13;&#10;by or equitably allocable to Landlord and/or any Landlord Affiliates therefor, including, without &#13;&#10;limitation legal fees, closing costs, escrow fees, recording fees, title examination and insurance &#13;&#10;costs, survey costs, due diligence investigation or monitoring costs and/or brokerage fees. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(2) The parties acknowledge that the 144 Chelmsford Lease contains &#13;&#10;provisions that are corollary to this Section 36(r) (the&quot;144 Chelmsford Profit Share Provisions&quot;) &#13;&#10;and agree that all accounting relevant to this this Section 36(r) shall occur in a manner consistent &#13;&#10;with all accounting relevant to the 144 Chelmsford Profit Share Provisions (in order that, among &#13;&#10;other things, there shall be no so-called &quot;double counting&quot; of any amounts owed, collectively, to &#13;&#10;Tenant pursuant to this Section 36(r) and/or to the tenant under the 144 Chelmsford Lease &#13;&#10;pursuant to the 144 Chelmsford Profit Share Provisions). &#13;&#10;(3) Any dispute under the foregoing provisions of this Section 36(r) &#13;&#10;shall be settled exclusively by Arbitration under Section 36(d) above. &#13;&#10;(4) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth herein, Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;rights under this Section 36(r) are personal to the Tenant originally named herein and any &#13;&#10;successor thereto pursuant to a Permitted Transfer, but shall not otherwise be transferable or &#13;&#10;assignable. Further notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Landlord shall &#13;&#10;have no obligation to pay Tenant any Profit Share Amount at any time in which Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;in default of any of its obligations under this Lease beyond any applicable notice or cure period. &#13;&#10;(s) No Merger. There shall be no merger of the leasehold estate created by this &#13;&#10;Lease with the fee estate in the Leased Parcel by reason of the fact that the same person or entity &#13;&#10;may own or hold (i) the leasehold estate created by this Lease or any interest in such leasehold &#13;&#10;estate and (ii) the fee estate in the Leased Parcel or any interest in such fee estate; and no such &#13;&#10;merger shall occur unless and until all persons and other entities having (a) any interest in this &#13;&#10;Lease or the leasehold estate created by this Lease (excluding subtenants) and (b) any fee &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Exhibit B, Page 1 &#13;&#10;EXHIBITB &#13;&#10;TENANT&#39;S WORK &#13;&#10;Tenant shall perform any work required to permit Tenant to occupy the Premises for the &#13;&#10;conduct of Tenant&#39;s business (&quot;Tenant&#39;s Work&quot;), including without limitation, the work (if any) &#13;&#10;described on Exhibit B-1 attached hereto. Tenant shall not commence any of Tenant&#39;s Work until &#13;&#10;Tenant has submitted to Landlord plans and specifications (in such detail as Landlord shall &#13;&#10;reasonably require) for such work and Landlord has approved such plans and specifications in &#13;&#10;writing. Landlord&#39;s approval of such plans and specifications shall not be unreasonably withheld, &#13;&#10;delayed or conditioned, subject to the terms and conditions of Section 8 of this Lease. Landlord&#39;s &#13;&#10;approval of Tenant&#39;s plans and specifications for Tenant&#39;s Work shall create no responsibility or &#13;&#10;liability on the part of Landlord for their completeness, design sufficiency, or compliance with &#13;&#10;any and all applicable laws. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s Work shall be performed in accordance with such approved plans and &#13;&#10;specifications and in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Lease, including, without &#13;&#10;limitation, Section 8 hereof. Tenant shall commence Tenant&#39;s Work promptly after receipt of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s approval of Tenant&#39;s plans and specifications (but not before the Commencement Date) &#13;&#10;and shall diligently prosecute the same to completion. Tenant&#39;s Work shall be performed in a good &#13;&#10;and workmanlike manner, and in compliance with all applicable laws. If Tenant does not then &#13;&#10;satisfy the Financial Prerequisite, then, prior to beginning Tenant&#39;s Work, Tenant shall obtain &#13;&#10;appropriate performance and payment bonds covering the labor and materials required to &#13;&#10;complete Tenant&#39;s Work. Landlord shall not be responsible to provide any construction &#13;&#10;management services to Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Subject to the provisions of Section 8, prior to beginning Tenant&#39;s Work, Tenant shall also &#13;&#10;deliver to Landlord and Landlord&#39;s mortgagee (if applicable), at Tenant&#39;s cost, a builder&#39;s risk &#13;&#10;insurance policy naming Landlord and Landlord&#39;s mortgagee as additional insureds, as their &#13;&#10;interests may appear, with the amount and type of coverage then being reasonably required by &#13;&#10;Landlord and Landlord&#39;s mortgagee and otherwise in compliance with the requirements for &#13;&#10;insurance set forth in Section 9 of this Lease, together with evidence that the premium for said &#13;&#10;insurance has been paid in full by Tenant for a period of no less than one year. All contractors and &#13;&#10;subcontractors shall be required to procure and maintain insurance against such risks, in such &#13;&#10;amounts, and with such companies as required under Section 9 of this Lease. Certificates of such &#13;&#10;insurance, with paid receipts therefor, must be received by Landlord before Tenant&#39;s Work is &#13;&#10;commenced. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Landlord shall provide to Tenant a construction allowance (the &quot;Construction &#13;&#10;Allowance&quot;) in the amount of Four Million Dollars ($4,000,000.00) for the Tenant&#39;s Work, as &#13;&#10;evidenced by copies of paid receipts for such work. The Construction Allowance shall not be used &#13;&#10;for Tenant&#39;s furniture, equipment, personal property, or trade fixtures but may however be used &#13;&#10;for improvements related to Tenant&#39;s business operations at either the Premises, 121 Hale Street, &#13;&#10;Lowell, MA and/or 144 Chelmsford Street, Lowell, MA. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Exhibit B, Page 2 &#13;&#10;Landlord shall upon execution of this Lease deposit the entire Construction Alowance with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s mortgagee (or, if there is no mortgagee with a title company, bank, trust company, &#13;&#10;fiduciary or other financial institutional approved by Tenant in its reasonable discretion) as the &#13;&#10;&quot;Escrow Agent&quot; and the Escrow Agent shall disburse the Construction Allowance to Tenant, not &#13;&#10;more frequently than once per month, for the purpose of reimbursing Tenant, in part, for its &#13;&#10;payments to contractors and subcontractors, materialmen and/or suppliers in connection with &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s Work. As a condition precedent to Landlord&#39;s obligation to pay the Construction &#13;&#10;Allowance or any portion thereof: (i) Tenant shall not be in default beyond any applicable notice &#13;&#10;and cure periods; (ii) this Lease shall be in full force and effect; and (iii) Tenant shall have furnished &#13;&#10;to Landlord and Escrow Agent (A) a certificate from Tenant&#39;s architect certifying that Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;Work has been fully completed to the extent of the funds requested in accordance with the plans &#13;&#10;and specifications therefor approved by Landlord; (B) such evidence as Landlord and/or &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s mortgagee may reasonably require to evidence that all persons furnishing or supplying &#13;&#10;labor and materials in connection with the construction of the Tenant&#39;s Work for which payment &#13;&#10;is required, or in the case of completion of a portion of the Tenant&#39;s Work, have been paid and &#13;&#10;that no lien exists of record with respect thereto; and (C) any other instruments, plans and/or &#13;&#10;certificates reasonably required by Landlord and/or Landlord&#39;s mortgagee. Landlord shall fund &#13;&#10;the Construction Allowance within fifteen (15) days from Tenant&#39;s written request for the same &#13;&#10;provided that Tenant has complied with the requirements set forth in the preceding sentence. Upon &#13;&#10;paying the full amount of the Construction Allowance to Tenant in accordance with the provisions &#13;&#10;hereof, Landlord shall have no further obligation to extend any credit to Tenant. Notwithstanding &#13;&#10;any provision in this Exhibit B or the Lease to the contrary, all of Tenant&#39;s Work must be fully &#13;&#10;completed, and all items to be provided to Landlord pursuant to this paragraph must be provided, &#13;&#10;within two (2) years from the date of execution of this Lease in order for Landord&#39;s obligations &#13;&#10;with respect to the Construction Allowance to apply. If Landlord fails to make the payment of the &#13;&#10;entire Construction Allowance as required hereunder and the same shall continue unremedied for &#13;&#10;twenty (20) days after Tenant&#39;s notice thereof to Landlord and Landlord&#39;s mortgagee, then Tenant &#13;&#10;may deduct any unpaid amount from all rent payments then or thereafter due until fully paid. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Exhibit B-1, Page 1 &#13;&#10;EXHIBIT B-1 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Exhibit C, Page 1 &#13;&#10;EXHIBIT C &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;SUBORDINATION, NON-DISTURBANCE AND &#13;&#10;ATTORNMENTAGREEMENT &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;This Subordination, Non-Disturbance and Attomment Agreement (this &quot;Agreement&quot;) is &#13;&#10;dated this day of , 2016 between -------------- &#13;&#10;(&quot;Lender&quot;) and MACOM TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS HOLDINGS INC., a Delaware &#13;&#10;corporation (&quot;Tenant&quot;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;RECITALS &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Tenant has entered into a certain lease (the &quot;Lease&quot;) dated , 2016 &#13;&#10;with (the &quot;Landlord&quot;) of the land and buildings located at 100 Chelmsford Street, &#13;&#10;Lowell, Massachusetts. The leased premises described in the Lease are hereinafter referred &#13;&#10;to as the &quot;Premises.&quot; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. Lender has made a loan to Landlord, which loan is secured by a mortgage and &#13;&#10;security agreement dated , 20 , recorded with the Essex North Registry of &#13;&#10;Deeds in Book , Page and filed with the Essex North Registry District of the &#13;&#10;Land Court as Document (the &quot;Mortgage&quot;), and an assignment of leases and rents &#13;&#10;dated , 20--&gt; recorded with said Registry in Book_, Page and filed with said &#13;&#10;land Court as Document (the &quot;Assignment&quot;), both with respect to the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;D. Capitalized terms used and not defined herein shall have the respective meanings set &#13;&#10;forth in the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;For mutual consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the &#13;&#10;parties hereto agree as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1. Tenant agrees that the leasehold of the Lease is and shall be subject and subordinate &#13;&#10;to the lien of the Mortgage and to the lien of the Assignment and to all renewals, amendments, &#13;&#10;modifications, consolidations, replacements and extensions thereof, now or hereafter executed, to &#13;&#10;the full extent of all amounts secured thereby, said subordination to have the same force and effect &#13;&#10;as if the Mortgage and the Assignment, and such renewals, modifications, consolidations, &#13;&#10;replacements and extensions thereof, had been executed, acknowledged, delivered and recorded prior &#13;&#10;to the execution and delivery of the Lease and any recorded notice or memorandum thereof, and &#13;&#10;amendments or modifications thereto. However, the foregoing subordination provision shall not be &#13;&#10;deemed or construed as limiting Tenant&#39;s rights under the Lease and/or Landlord&#39;s obligations &#13;&#10;thereunder, including without limitation with respect to the use of insurance proceeds and &#13;&#10;condemnation awards and, notwithstanding any inconsistent provisions of the Mortgage with respect &#13;&#10;thereto, such proceeds and awards shall be applied as set forth in the Lease. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage276"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Exhibit C, Page 2 &#13;&#10;2. Lender agrees that Tenant shall not be named or joined as a party defendant in any &#13;&#10;action, suit or proceeding which may be instituted by Lender to foreclose or seek other remedies &#13;&#10;under the Mortgage or the Assignment by reason of a default or event of default under the &#13;&#10;Mortgage or the Assignment, unless applicable law requires Tenant to be made a party thereto as &#13;&#10;a condition to Lender&#39;s proceeding against Landlord or prosecuting such rights and remedies. &#13;&#10;Lender further agrees that, in the event of any entry by Lender pursuant to the Mortgage, a &#13;&#10;foreclosure of the Mortgage, or the exercise by Lender of any of its rights under the Mortgage or &#13;&#10;Assignment, Lender shall not disturb Tenant&#39;s right of possession of the Premises under the terms &#13;&#10;of the Lease so long as Tenant is not in default beyond applicable notice and cure periods in the &#13;&#10;Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. Tenant agrees that, in the event of a foreclosure of the Mortgage by Lender, the &#13;&#10;acceptance of a deed in lieu of foreclosure by Lender, or Lender&#39;s exercise of any of its rights &#13;&#10;under the Mortgage or Assignment, Tenant will attorn to and recognize Lender as its landlord &#13;&#10;under the Lease for the remainder of the term of the Lease (including all optional extension terms &#13;&#10;which have been or are hereafter exercised) upon the same terms and conditions as are set forth &#13;&#10;in the Lease, and Tenant hereby agrees to perform all of the obligations of Tenant pursuant to the &#13;&#10;Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. Tenant agrees that, in the event Lender succeeds to the interest of Landlord under &#13;&#10;the Lease: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Lender shall not be liable in damages for any act or omission of any prior &#13;&#10;landlord (including Landlord), provided nothing herein shall derogate from the &#13;&#10;obligation of Lender to perform all of the obligations of Landlord pursuant to the &#13;&#10;Lease arising, accruing or continuing from and after such time as Lender succeeds &#13;&#10;to the interest of Landlord under the Lease; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Lender shall not be liable for the return of any security deposit unless such &#13;&#10;security deposit is actually received by Lender; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Lender shall not be bound by any Base Rent or additional rent which Tenant &#13;&#10;might have prepaid for more than one (1) month in advance under the Lease (unless &#13;&#10;so required to have been prepaid under the Lease); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Lender shall not be bound by any amendments or modifications of the &#13;&#10;Lease made after the date hereof without consent of Lender which have the effect &#13;&#10;of materially increasing Landlord&#39;s obligations under the Lease, reducing rent or &#13;&#10;otherwise materially reducing any of Tenant&#39;s obligations under the Lease, &#13;&#10;decreasing the Term or canceling the Lease prior to its expiration except as a result &#13;&#10;of the exercise of a right to terminate as set forth in the Lease; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Lender shall not be subject to any offsets or defenses which Tenant might &#13;&#10;have against any prior landlord (including Landlord) except in cases where Tenant &#13;&#10;has given Lender notice of the event or circumstances giving rise to such &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Exhibit C, Page 3 &#13;&#10;damages, offsets or defenses and afforded Lender the same period of time in which &#13;&#10;to cure as is provided to Landlord under the Lease; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Lender shall not be bound by any provisions in the Lease which obligate &#13;&#10;Landlord to erect or complete any building and/or to make any improvements to &#13;&#10;the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;5. Lender hereby approves of, and consents to, the Lease. Notwithstanding anything &#13;&#10;to the contrary contained in the Mortgage or the Assignment, Tenant shall be entitled to use and &#13;&#10;occupy the Premises and exercise all its rights under the Lease, and the Lease and Landlord&#39;s and &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s performance thereunder shall not constitute a default under the Mortgage or Assignment. &#13;&#10;Tenant agrees to give Lender a copy of any notice of default under the Lease served upon &#13;&#10;Landlord at the same time as such notice is given to Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6. [Intentionally deleted.] &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7. The terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be automatic and self-operative &#13;&#10;without execution of any further instruments on the part of any of the parties hereto. Without &#13;&#10;limiting the foregoing, however, Lender and Tenant agree, within thirty (30) days after request &#13;&#10;therefor by the other party, to execute an instrument in confirmation of the foregoing provisions, &#13;&#10;in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to Lender and Tenant, pursuant to which the parties &#13;&#10;shall acknowledge the continued effectiveness of the Lease in the event of such foreclosure or &#13;&#10;other exercise of rights. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;8. Any notice to be delivered hereunder shall be in writing and shall be sent registered &#13;&#10;or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, or overnight delivery by Federal &#13;&#10;Express or similar overnight courier which delivers upon signed receipt of the addressee, or its &#13;&#10;agent. The time of the giving of any notice shall be the time of receipt thereof by the addressee or &#13;&#10;any agent of the addressee, except that in the event that the addressee shall refuse to receive any &#13;&#10;notice, or there shall be no person available (during normal business hours) to receive such notice, &#13;&#10;the time of giving notice shall be deemed to be the time of such refusal or attempted delivery as &#13;&#10;the case may be. All notices addressed to Lender or Tenant, as the case may be, shall be delivered &#13;&#10;to the respective addresses set forth opposite their names below, or such other addresses as they &#13;&#10;may hereafter specify by written notice delivered in accordance herewith: &#13;&#10;If to Tenant: &#13;&#10;with a copy &#13;&#10;simultaneously to: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;If to Lender: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9. The term &quot;Lender&quot; as used herein includes any direct or more remote successor or &#13;&#10;assign of the named Lender herein, including without limitation, any purchaser at a foreclosure &#13;&#10;sale, and any successor or assign thereof, and the term &quot;Tenant&quot; as used herein includes any &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;FIFTH AMENDMENT TO LEASE &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;121 Hale Street, Lowell, MA &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;This FIFTH AMENDMENT TO LEASE (this &quot;Amendment&quot;) is entered into as of &#13;&#10;----&#13;&#10; _, 2016 (the &quot;Effective Date&quot;) by and between HALE CPI, LLC (&quot;Landlord&quot;), and &#13;&#10;MACOM TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS HOLDINGS, INC. (&quot;Tenant&quot;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, ND Hale Street LLC, as predecessor-in-interest to Landlord (the &quot;Original &#13;&#10;Landlord&quot;), as landlord, and GES US (New England) Inc. (the &quot;Original Tenant&quot;), as tenant, &#13;&#10;entered into that certain Lease dated May 31, 2007 (the &quot;Original Lease&quot;) relating to certain land &#13;&#10;with the buildings thereon in Lowell, Massachusetts known as and numbered 121 Hale Street, as &#13;&#10;amended by that certain First Amendment to Lease dated as of September 8, 2008 (the &quot;First &#13;&#10;Amendment&quot;), as affected by that certain Certificate Affirming Dates dated as of April_, 2009, as &#13;&#10;further amended by that certain Second Amendment to Lease dated as of June 2010 (the &quot;Second &#13;&#10;Amendment&quot;), as affected by that certain Assignment of Lease dated March 31, 2011 (the &quot;2011 &#13;&#10;Assignment&quot;) by and between Original Tenant and MACOM Technology Solutions, Inc. f/k/a &#13;&#10;M/A-Com Technology Solutions, Inc. (the &quot;Intervening Tenant&quot;) and by that certain Landlord&#39;s &#13;&#10;Consent to Assignment of Lease dated March 31, 2011 by and among Original Landlord, Original &#13;&#10;Tenant, and the Intervening Tenant (the &quot;2011 Consent&quot;), as further amended by that certain Third &#13;&#10;Amendment to Lease dated as of March 31, 2011 (the &quot;Third Amendment&quot;), as further amended &#13;&#10;by that certain Fourth Amendment to Lease dated as of October 4, 2012 (the &quot;Fourth &#13;&#10;Amendment&quot;), and as affected by that certain Assignment of Lease of even date herewith by and &#13;&#10;between the Intervening Tenant and Tenant (the &quot;2016 Assignment&quot;) and by that certain &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s Consent to Assignment of Lease of even date herewith by and among Landlord, the &#13;&#10;Intervening Tenant, and Tenant (the &quot;2016 Consent&quot;) (the Original Lease, as so amended and &#13;&#10;affected, being herein referred to as the &quot;Lease&quot;); and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, Tenant is the successor to the Original Tenant pursuant to the terms of the &#13;&#10;2016 Assignment (as affected by the 2016 Consent); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;WHERAS, simultaneously herewith, , an affiliate of Landlord (in its &#13;&#10;capacity as landlord under the 144 Chelmsford Lease, the &quot;144 Landlord&quot;) and MACOM &#13;&#10;Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. (in its capacity as tenant under the 144 Chelmsford Lease, &#13;&#10;the &quot;144 Tenant&quot;) are entering into a lease agreement (the &quot;144 Chelmsford Lease&quot;) pursuant to &#13;&#10;which the 144 Landlord will lease to the 144 Tenant a certain parcel adjacent to the Leased &#13;&#10;Premises as shown as &quot;144 CHELMSFORD PARCEL&quot; on the plan attached hereto as Exhibit A (the &#13;&#10;&quot;144 Parcel&quot;) and, subject to the terms and conditions set forth therein, to construct a project (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Project&quot;) consisting of a new building on the 144 Parcel and certain site improvements (the &quot;Site &#13;&#10;Improvements&quot;) to the 144 Parcel, the 100 Parcel (as defined below) and the Leased Premises; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, simultaneously herewith, , an affiliate of Landlord (in &#13;&#10;its capacity as landlord under the I 00 Chelmsford Lease, the &quot;100 Landlord&quot;) and MACOM &#13;&#10;Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. (in its capacity as tenant under the I 00 Chelmsford Lease, &#13;&#10;the &quot;I 00 Tenant&quot;) are entering into a lease agreement (the &quot;I 00 Chelmsford Lease&quot;) pursuant to &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	4 &#13;&#10;Procedures prov1s1ons of the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration &#13;&#10;Association (or another arbitration company mutually acceptable to Landlord and Tenant) and &#13;&#10;otherwise under the terms of this clause (ii). Any such Arbitration shall occur in a location &#13;&#10;mutually convenient to Landlord and Tenant (or, if Landlord and Tenant cannot agree on a &#13;&#10;mutually convenient location, in the City of Boston, Massachusetts). The decision of the arbitrator &#13;&#10;shall be final, conclusive and binding on the parties, but the arbitrator shall have no power to &#13;&#10;reform, supplement or modify the Lease. The arbitrator shall make required findings incident to &#13;&#10;an arbitrable dispute, which findings shall be set forth in reasonable detail in a written decision by &#13;&#10;the arbitrator. Unless otherwise expressly provided hereunder, the parties shall share equally in &#13;&#10;all costs charged by the arbitrator or the arbitration company and each party shall otherwise bear &#13;&#10;its own costs (including attorneys&#39; fees) of any Arbitration. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the &#13;&#10;arbitrator may (but shall not be obligated to), in its sole discretion, determine the prevailing party &#13;&#10;in any such Arbitration and award such prevailing party all of the prevailing party&#39;s costs and &#13;&#10;expenses incurred in connection with the Arbitration (including without limitation attorneys&#39; fees &#13;&#10;and costs). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) For the avoidance of doubt, the parties acknowledge that under no &#13;&#10;circumstances shall Landlord have any liability to Tenant under the Lease on account of (x) the &#13;&#10;144 Landlord&#39;s acts or omissions under the 144 Chelmsford Lease or (y) the 100 Landlord&#39;s acts &#13;&#10;or omissions under the 100 Chelmsford Lease. For the avoidance of doubt, the parties further &#13;&#10;acknowledge that under no circumstances shall Tenant have any liability to Landlord under the &#13;&#10;Lease on account of (A) the 144 Tenant&#39;s acts or omissions under the 144 Chelmsford Lease or &#13;&#10;(B) the 100 Tenant&#39;s acts or omissions under the 100 Chelmsford Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Other Documents &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Reference is made to a certain Reciprocal Easement Agreement of even date &#13;&#10;herewith being entered into and recorded with the Middlesex North Registry of Deeds and filed with &#13;&#10;the Middlesex Registry District of the Land Court concurrently with the execution and delivery of this &#13;&#10;Amendment (the &quot;REA&quot;). Tenant is &#13;&#10;hereby designated as the Major Tenant of the Hale Property. 	5 &#13;&#10;pertain to Tenant&#39;s (A) use or occupancy of the Leased Premises, (B) exercise or enjoyment of &#13;&#10;any of Tenant&#39;s rights under the Lease, or (C) compliance with any of Tenant&#39;s obligations under &#13;&#10;the Lease (collectively, &quot;Lease Matters&quot;); provided that such Lease Matters shall in no event be &#13;&#10;deemed to include (x) any obligation of Landlord under any Other Document that is an obligation &#13;&#10;of Landlord to Tenant as expressly set forth in the Lease or (y) any liability to the extent caused &#13;&#10;by the negligence or willful act of Landlord. Tenant shall, from time to time upon the reasonable &#13;&#10;request by Landlord, provide reasonable evidence of Tenant&#39;s compliance with the terms of the &#13;&#10;preceding sentence (with respect to any specific obligations of Tenant thereunder). In any event, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall not cause, suffer or permit any act or omission on or about the Leased Premises or &#13;&#10;otherwise in connection with any Lease Matters that would cause Landlord to be in violation (a &#13;&#10;&quot;Violation&quot;) of any of the Other Documents. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) Landlord shall (A) perform and observe all of the terms, covenants, &#13;&#10;provisions and conditions of any Other Documents on Landlord&#39;s part to be performed and &#13;&#10;observed pursuant to the terms thereof, except for such obligations as are Tenant&#39;s responsibility &#13;&#10;as set forth above, and (B) enforce the obligations of the other parties to any of the Other &#13;&#10;Documents (an &quot;Other Party&quot;), in each case to the extent necessary for Landlord to comply with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s obligations to Tenant under the Lease. In no event whatsoever shall either party hereto &#13;&#10;have any liability to the other on account of (x) any Other Party&#39;s failure to keep, observe or &#13;&#10;perform its obligations pursuant to the Other Document or (y) the acts or omissions of any Other &#13;&#10;Party, its agents, employees, invitees, guests, licenses or contractors. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iv) In any case where Tenant shall request Landlord&#39;s consent, permission or &#13;&#10;approval for any matter requiring Landlord&#39;s consent, permission or approval as set forth in the &#13;&#10;Lease (a &quot;Consent Request&quot;) then, to the extent that such matter shall also require the consent, &#13;&#10;permission or approval of an Other Owner, other than a Landlord Affiliate, under an Other &#13;&#10;Document (an &quot;Other Owner Consent&quot;), Landlord shall have no obligation to act upon the Consent &#13;&#10;Request unless and until such time as the Other Owner Consent shall have been given. Upon &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s reasonable determination that the Consent Request is complete and in proper form for &#13;&#10;consideration under both the Lease and the Other Document, Landlord shall request the Other &#13;&#10;Owner Consent in accordance with the Other Document and thereafter use commercially &#13;&#10;reasonable efforts in accordance with the Other Document to obtain the Other Owner Consent. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to the contrary contained herein, any Consent Request &#13;&#10;to Landlord shall also be deemed to have been made to any Landlord Affiliate that is an Other &#13;&#10;Owner. As used herein, &quot;Landlord Affiliate&quot; shall mean Landlord and/or a party that controls, is &#13;&#10;controlled by, or is under common control with Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(v) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth above in this subsection &#13;&#10;(b), Landlord may by notice to Tenant require, in lieu of Landlord&#39;s taking any direct action with &#13;&#10;respect to any Other Party or Other Document as set forth above in this subsection (b), that Tenant, &#13;&#10;at Tenant&#39;s sole cost and expense (except to the extent that the action is required as a result of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s failure to have performed an obligation of Landlord under the Lease), take such action &#13;&#10;on Landlord&#39;s behalf and in its name and, for purposes thereof, Tenant shall be deemed subrogated &#13;&#10;to Landlord&#39;s rights under the Other Document to take such action. In taking any such action, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall have the right, but not the obligation to exercise any or all rights and remedies as &#13;&#10;would be available to Landlord, at law or in equity, were Landlord to take the action directly. &#13;&#10;Landlord agrees to sign, to the extent Landlord&#39;s signature is legally required or &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	6 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;required under the provisions of the Other Document, such demands, pleadings, and/or other &#13;&#10;documents that may be reasonably required, and otherwise to enable Tenant to proceed as set &#13;&#10;forth above in this clause (v). In the event Landlord exercises its rights under this clause (v), &#13;&#10;Tenant shall provide Landlord with copies of all written notices, demands, communications and &#13;&#10;correspondence of a material nature sent or received by Tenant in connection therewith, &#13;&#10;simultaneously with their sending by Tenant or promptly upon their receipt by Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. INDUCEMENT PAYMENT &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Cconcurrently with the execution and delivery of this Amendment, Landlord is paying to &#13;&#10;Tenant the sum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000.00) as an inducement for Tenant&#39;s &#13;&#10;execution and delivery of this Amendment. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. MISCELLANEOUS &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a. Concurrently herewith, the parties are amending and restating in its entirety the &#13;&#10;Notice of Lease pursuant to the parties&#39; execution, delivery and recording of the Amended and &#13;&#10;Restated Notice of Lease in the form set forth in Exhibit B attached hereto. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;b. The parties acknowledge that the &quot;Effective Date,&quot; as that term is defined in the &#13;&#10;2011 Assignment, occurred as of April 7, 2011 and that the Sublease, as that term is defined in &#13;&#10;the 2011 Assignment, was thereby terminated as of April 7, 2011. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;c. The Lease is modified such that each reference therein to the Lease shall be deemed &#13;&#10;to mean the Lease as modified by this Amendment. In the event of any conflict between the terms &#13;&#10;of the Lease and the terms of this Amendment, the terms of this Amendment shall prevail. Except as &#13;&#10;otherwise expressly amended, modified and provided for in this Amendment, Tenant hereby ratifies &#13;&#10;all of the provisions, covenants and conditions of the Lease, and such provisions, covenants and &#13;&#10;conditions shall be deemed to be incorporated herein and made a part hereof and shall continue in full &#13;&#10;force and effect. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;d. Landlord and Tenant each warrant to the other that the person or persons executing &#13;&#10;this Amendment on its behalf has or have authority to do so and that such execution has fully &#13;&#10;obligated and bound such party to all terms and provisions of this Amendment. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;e. Landlord and Tenant hereby represent and warrant to each other that neither has dealt &#13;&#10;with any real estate broker or agent in connection with the procurement of this Amendment. Each of &#13;&#10;Landlord and Tenant shall indemnify and hold the other harmless from any costs, expenses or &#13;&#10;liabilities (including costs of suit and reasonable attorneys&#39; fees) for any compensation, commission &#13;&#10;or fees claimed by any real estate broker or in connection with the procurement of this Amendment &#13;&#10;because of any act or statement by the indemnifying party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;f. This Amendment shall be binding upon, and shall inure to the benefit of the parties &#13;&#10;hereto, and their respective successors and assigns. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;g. This Amendment shall be governed by the laws of The Commonwealth of &#13;&#10;Massachusetts. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	7 &#13;&#10;h. If any clause or provision of this Amendment is or should ever beheld to be illegal, &#13;&#10;invalid or unenforceable under any present or future law applicable to the terms hereof; then and &#13;&#10;in that event, it is the intention of the parties hereto that the remainder of this Amendment shall &#13;&#10;not be affected thereby, and that in lieu of each such clause or provision of this Amendment that &#13;&#10;is illegal, invalid or unenforceable, such clause or provision shall be judicially construed and &#13;&#10;interpreted to be as similar in substance and content to such, illegal, invalid or unenforceable &#13;&#10;clause or provision, as the context thereof would reasonably suggest, so as to thereafter be legal, &#13;&#10;valid and enforceable. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;i. This Amendment may be executed simultaneously in two or more counterparts, &#13;&#10;each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the &#13;&#10;same instrument. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;[Signatures begin on next page.] &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	8 &#13;&#10;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused these presents to be executed, &#13;&#10;as a sealed instrument, the day and year first above written. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Landlord: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;HALE CPI, LLC, a Massachusetts limited &#13;&#10;liability company &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;By: &#13;&#10;Name: &#13;&#10;Title: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;MACOM TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS &#13;&#10;HOLDINGS, INC. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;By:----------- &#13;&#10;Name: &#13;&#10;Title: &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-2 &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, the 144 Property is subject to a lease of even date herewith (as the same &#13;&#10;may be hereafter amended from time to time, the &quot;144 Lease&quot;) between the 144 Owner, as &#13;&#10;landlord, and MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation, as tenant &#13;&#10;(including its successors or assigns as holders from time to time of such tenant&#39;s interest, the &#13;&#10;&quot;144 Tenant&quot;), notice of which 144 Lease (the &quot;144 Notice of Lease&quot;) is being recorded with the &#13;&#10;Registry (as defined herein) and filed with the Land Court (as defined herein) concurrently &#13;&#10;herewith; &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, pursuant to the 144 Lease, the 144 Owner and the 144 Tenant have agreed &#13;&#10;upon certain terms and conditions under which the 144 Owner will perform certain work (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Project Work&quot;) consisting of the construction of (i) a new building on the 144 Property (the &#13;&#10;&quot;144 Building&quot;) and (ii) related site improvements on each of the 100 Property, 144 Property and &#13;&#10;Hale Property, all as approximately shown on the site plan attached hereto as Exhibit B (with &#13;&#10;such site improvements, as more particularly described in the 144 Lease and as the same are &#13;&#10;subject to the terms of this Agreement, being herein the &quot;Project Site Improvements&quot;); &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, the 144 Lease also provides that, under certain circumstances as set forth in &#13;&#10;the 144 Lease, the 144 Owner will have no further obligation to perform the Project Work but &#13;&#10;the 144 Tenant will have certain rights to develop (and thereafter demolish) a building or &#13;&#10;buildings on the 144 Property and, in connection therewith, to make related site improvements &#13;&#10;on the 100 Property and the 144 Property as set forth in the 144 Lease and as subject to the terms &#13;&#10;of this Agreement (the &quot;Alternative Site Improvements&quot;); &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, the 100 Property is subject to a lease of even date herewith (as the same &#13;&#10;may be hereafter amended from time to time, the &quot;100 Lease&quot;) between the 100 Owner, as &#13;&#10;landlord, and MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation, as tenant &#13;&#10;(including its successors or assigns as holders from time to time of such tenant&#39;s interest, the &#13;&#10;&quot;100 Tenant&quot;), notice of which 100 Lease (the &quot;100 Notice of Lease&quot;) is being recorded with &#13;&#10;the Registry and filed with the Land Court concurrently herewith; &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, the Hale Property is subject to a lease dated May 31, 200 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7 as amended (as the same may be hereafter amended from time to time, the &quot;Hale &#13;&#10;Lease&quot;) between the Hale Owner, as successor in interest to ND Hale Street LLC, as landlord, &#13;&#10;and MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation, as successor in &#13;&#10;interest to GES US (New England) Inc., as tenant (including its successors or assigns as holders &#13;&#10;from time to time of such tenant&#39;s interest, the &quot;Hale Tenant&quot;), notice of which Hale Lease is &#13;&#10;recorded with the Registry at Book 27742, Page 195, and as to which an Amended and Restated &#13;&#10;Notice of Lease (the &quot;Hale Notice of Lease&quot;) is being recorded with the Registry concurrently &#13;&#10;herewith; and &#13;&#10;WHEREAS, the Owners wish to establish certain easements, rights, and obligations with &#13;&#10;respect to the Properties in order for the 144 Owner to construct the Project Site Improvements &#13;&#10;(or, in the alternative, for the 144 Tenant, in the exercise of its rights in accordance with the 144 &#13;&#10;Lease, to construct the Alternative Site Improvements on the 100 Property and the 144 Property) &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
