<!-- SLIDE 0210 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023210.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 210" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-3 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;and for the Owners to use, maintain, operate, alter and improve the Properties in a harmonious &#13;&#10;manner, in each case to the extent provided for herein. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and mutual rights and &#13;&#10;obligations set forth herein, and for $1.00 the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby &#13;&#10;acknowledged, the Owners hereby agree as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;I. EASEMENTS. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Generally. The rights and easements expressly specified below under this &#13;&#10;Section I (collectively, the &quot;Easements,&quot; with each thereof being an &quot;Easement&quot;) are hereby &#13;&#10;granted from each Owner, as applicable as set forth below, to each of the other Owners, as &#13;&#10;applicable as set forth below. Except to the extent otherwise expressly set forth herein, all &#13;&#10;easements under this Agreement are granted (i) irrevocably and in perpetuity, (ii) for the &#13;&#10;exclusive benefit of the grantee Owners (in common, however, with the grantor Owner and the &#13;&#10;other grantee Owner, as applicable), (iii) for use by the grantee Owners and their respective &#13;&#10;tenants, occupants, licensees, designees and invitees on their respective Properties, (iv) subject to &#13;&#10;all of the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, (v) subject to any prior easements and &#13;&#10;matters ofrecord insofar as are in force and applicable, (vi) without covenants express or implied &#13;&#10;and (vii) without representation or warranty of any kind (including without limitation as to &#13;&#10;habitability or fitness for any particular use or purpose). Except as expressly set forth herein, no &#13;&#10;other easements are hereby created, whether by necessity or implication. The areas respectively &#13;&#10;designated below as being subject to particular Easements are referred to herein as the &#13;&#10;&quot;Easement Areas,&quot; with each such area being an &quot;Easement Area.&quot; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. Existing Facilities. Each of the 100 Owner and the 144 Owner shall have an &#13;&#10;easement over the other&#39;s Property for: (i) the passage of pedestrians and vehicles upon, over &#13;&#10;and across any driveways and parking areas as may be now located on the grantor Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;Property; (ii) the passage of pedestrians upon, over and across any sidewalks and walkways as &#13;&#10;may be now located on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (iii) the drainage and discharge of surface &#13;&#10;water collected on the grantee Owner&#39;s Property onto, upon, over, across, under and through any &#13;&#10;areas as may now be utilized therefor by the grantee Owner on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; &#13;&#10;(iv) the use, operation, maintenance, repair, and replacement of any underground utility lines, &#13;&#10;pipes, conduits, systems and similar equipment and facilities as may be now be utilized by the &#13;&#10;grantee Owner on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (v) passive Recreational Uses (as defined &#13;&#10;herein) upon, over and across any areas as may now be utilized therefor by the grantee Owner on &#13;&#10;the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; and (vi) the parking of automobiles, light trucks and vans in any &#13;&#10;striped parking areas as may be now located on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property. The foregoing &#13;&#10;Easements under this Section B are collectively referred to as the &quot;Existing Easements.&quot; The &#13;&#10;Existing Easements shall expire and be of no further force and effect on the Project Site &#13;&#10;Improvements Effective Date or on the Alternative Site Improvements Effective Date (each as &#13;&#10;defined herein and as applicable) without the need for execution or recording/filing of any &#13;&#10;further documentation. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;C. The Project Site Improvements. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage305"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0211 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023211.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 211" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-4 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Upon substantial completion of the Project Site Improvements, the 100 &#13;&#10;Owner and the 144 Owner shall sign a certificate indicating the date of substantial completion &#13;&#10;(the &quot;Project Site Improvements Effective Date&quot;), which certificate shall be recorded with the &#13;&#10;Registry and filed with the Land Court. Upon the recording and filing of said certificate, each of &#13;&#10;the applicable Owners shall have the following rights and easements: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Access. Each of the Owners shall have an easement for the &#13;&#10;passage of pedestrians and vehicles upon, over and across the areas &#13;&#10;designated on the plan attached hereto as Exhibit C (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Easement Plan&quot;) as &quot;COMMON DRIVEWAY&quot; (the &quot;Driveway &#13;&#10;Easement Area&quot;). Each Owner shall have the right to construct &#13;&#10;and maintain driveways for ingress and egress connecting portions &#13;&#10;of its respective Property to portions of the Driveway Easement &#13;&#10;Area located on its respective Property, provided that no such &#13;&#10;connecting driveway shall unreasonably interfere with any rights &#13;&#10;granted to the other Owners hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Walkways. Each of the Owners shall have an easement for the &#13;&#10;passage of pedestrians upon, over and across the areas shown on &#13;&#10;the Easement Plan as the &quot;COMMON WALKWAYS&quot; (the &quot;Walkway &#13;&#10;Easement Area&quot;). Each Owner shall have the right to construct &#13;&#10;and maintain sidewalks or other pedestrian pathways providing &#13;&#10;access and egress from portions of its respective Property to &#13;&#10;portions of the Walkway Easement Area located on its respective &#13;&#10;Property, provided that no such sidewalk or pathway shall &#13;&#10;unreasonably interfere with any rights granted to the other Owners &#13;&#10;hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Stormwater. Each of the Owners shall have an easement for the &#13;&#10;drainage and discharge of surface water collected on its respective &#13;&#10;Property onto, upon, over, across, under and through the areas &#13;&#10;designated on the Easement Plan as the &quot;STORMWATER SYSTEM&quot; &#13;&#10;consisting of series of catch basins, manholes, drain lines, &#13;&#10;underground detention and/or recharge units, and appurtenant &#13;&#10;equipment (the &quot;Stormwater Easement Area&quot;). Each Owner &#13;&#10;shall have the right to construct and maintain appropriate &#13;&#10;stormwater drainage facilities connecting portions of its respective &#13;&#10;Property to portions of the Stormwater Easement Area located on &#13;&#10;its respective Property, provided that no such connections shall &#13;&#10;unreasonably interfere with any rights granted to the other Owners &#13;&#10;hereunder. All connections to the Stormwater System shall be &#13;&#10;made at the sole cost and expense of each respective Owner and in &#13;&#10;accordance with all applicable Governmental Approvals (as &#13;&#10;defined below). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Utilities. Each of the Owners shall have an easement for the use, &#13;&#10;operation, maintenance, repair, and replacement of underground &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

Any area in which such Utility Lines are so &#13;&#10;placed shall be no wider than necessary to reasonably satisfy the &#13;&#10;requirements of a private or public utility company, or five (5) feet &#13;&#10;on each side of the centerline. All Utility Lines shall be located &#13;&#10;underground, except for ground mounted electrical transformers, &#13;&#10;risers and fire hydrants and except as may be necessary during &#13;&#10;periods of construction, reconstruction, repair or temporary &#13;&#10;service, required by any Governmental Approvals or reasonably &#13;&#10;and customarily required by the provider of such utility service. &#13;&#10;Each Owner shall have the right to construct and maintain utility &#13;&#10;lines connecting portions of its respective Property to portions of &#13;&#10;the Utility Easement Area located on its respective Property, &#13;&#10;provided that no such connections shall unreasonably interfere &#13;&#10;with any rights granted to the other Owners hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(t) &#13;&#10;Common/Recreational Areas and Landscaping. Each of the 100 Owner and the 144 Owner shall have an &#13;&#10;easement for parking of automobiles, light trucks and vans in the &#13;&#10;striped parking areas located from time to time on each Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;respective Property and designated on the Site Plan as the &#13;&#10;&quot;Common Parking&quot; (the &quot;Parking Easement Area&quot;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) The Project Site Improvements shall be subject to change from time to &#13;&#10;time in accordance with the 144 Lease; provided, however, that in no event shall any Project Site &#13;&#10;Improvements be changed unless the Project Site Improvements will not (a) have a material &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-6 &#13;&#10;any then existing buildings and improvements at the 100 Property or 144 Property as determined &#13;&#10;by each of (x) the 100 Owner and its Major Tenant (if any) and (y) the Hale Owner and its Major &#13;&#10;Tenant (if any), respectively, in its respective reasonable discretion, (b) violate the terms and &#13;&#10;conditions of this Agreement or any Other Documents affecting the 100 Property or 144 &#13;&#10;Property, respectively, (c) violate or interfere with the leasehold rights and interests of the Major &#13;&#10;Tenant or any other tenant or occupant of the 100 Property or 144 Property, respectively, except &#13;&#10;to the extent that any such other tenant or occupant shall have consented thereto in writing in &#13;&#10;accordance with the terms and conditions of its applicable lease or occupancy agreement as shall &#13;&#10;then be in effect, or (d) violate any applicable laws, regulations, ordinances and rules, including &#13;&#10;then applicable zoning laws (without the need for an amendment to the applicable zoning &#13;&#10;ordinance or map, except to the extent that the 100 Owner and its Major Tenant (if any) or the &#13;&#10;100 Owner and its Major Tenant (if any), respectively, shall consent in writing to any such &#13;&#10;amendment in writing, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed). &#13;&#10;As used herein, &quot;Other Documents&quot; shall mean (x) the matters set forth in Exhibit D attached &#13;&#10;hereto, (y) any future easements, covenants or restrictions ofrecord as to which this Agreement &#13;&#10;shall have been made subject or subordinate and (z) the terms and conditions of any &#13;&#10;Governmental Approvals of record with respect to the Project Site Improvements (or Alternative &#13;&#10;Site Improvements, if applicable), all insofar as may be in force and applicable. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;D. The Alternative Site Improvements. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Upon substantial completion of the Alternative Site Improvements, the &#13;&#10;100 Owner and the 144 Owner shall sign a certificate indicating the date of substantial &#13;&#10;completion (the &quot;Alternative Site Improvements Effective Date&quot;), which certificate shall be &#13;&#10;recorded with the Registry and filed with the Land Court. Upon the recording and filing of said &#13;&#10;certificate, each of the 100 Owner and 144 Owner shall have an easement over the other&#39;s &#13;&#10;Property for: (i) the passage of pedestrians and vehicles upon, over and across any driveways &#13;&#10;and parking areas as shall then be located on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (ii) the passage of &#13;&#10;pedestrians upon, over and across any sidewalks and walkways as shall then be located on the &#13;&#10;grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (iii) the drainage and discharge of surface water collected on the &#13;&#10;grantee Owner&#39;s Property onto, upon, over, across, under and through any areas as may then be &#13;&#10;designed to be utilized therefor by the grantee Owner on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (iv) the &#13;&#10;use, operation, maintenance, repair, and replacement of any underground utility lines, pipes, &#13;&#10;conduits, systems and similar equipment and facilities as may then be designed to be utilized by &#13;&#10;the grantee Owner on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property; (v) passive Recreational Uses (as defined &#13;&#10;herein) upon, over and across any areas as may then be designed to be utilized therefor on the &#13;&#10;grantor Owner&#39;s Property; and (vi) the parking of automobiles, light trucks and vans in any &#13;&#10;striped parking areas as may then be located on the grantor Owner&#39;s Property. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) The portions of the Subject Property to be so entered by the 144 Owner shall &#13;&#10;be limited to such portions thereof as shall be reasonably necessary in order &#13;&#10;to perform the Project Work in a diligent manner consistent with prudent &#13;&#10;construction practices; provided that in no event shall the 144 Owner enter &#13;&#10;any building or other secured area on the Subject Property without the approval &#13;&#10;of the other Owner and its Major Tenant, if any, (which approval may be &#13;&#10;made subject to reasonable safety and security procedures and shall otherwise &#13;&#10;not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) The 144 Owner will enter the Subject Property and perform the work at the &#13;&#10;144 Owner&#39;s sole risk and at the 144 Owner&#39;s sole cost and expense &#13;&#10;(including all design, permitting and construction costs). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iv) The 144 Owner shall comply with all laws and regulations applicable to all &#13;&#10;Project Work on the Subject Property and shall obtain (and deliver to the &#13;&#10;other Owner and its Major Tenant, if any, copies of) all Governmental &#13;&#10;Approvals required in connection therewith. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

&#13;&#10;(x) Upon completion of the Project Work, the 144 Owner shall promptly &#13;&#10;remove from the Subject Property any surplus materials and waste created &#13;&#10;by the Project Work and shall promptly repair and restore any damage to &#13;&#10;the Subject Property that results from the Project Work. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;In exercising its rights and performing its obligations under this Section F, the 144 Tenant shall &#13;&#10;be subject to the same obligations as the 144 Owner would be bound by under the other provisions &#13;&#10;of this Agreement (including without limitation the indemnification obligations under Section IV. &#13;&#10;B. below) were the 144 Owner the party entitled to exercise the rights of the 144 Tenant under &#13;&#10;this Section F. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;II. RESTRICTIONS AND CONDITIONS &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Construction of Improvements. The rights granted to the Owners in the &#13;&#10;Easement Areas shall specifically include the right to construct, reconstruct, and maintain the &#13;&#10;improvements on their respective Properties as are existing on the Effective Date or as may be &#13;&#10;hereafter existing in accordance with the Project Site Improvements or the Alternative Site &#13;&#10;Improvements (as applicable). Each of the Owners agrees that all work performed by such &#13;&#10;Owner within an Easement Area located on its Property shall be (i) performed in a good and &#13;&#10;workmanlike manner using materials of good quality in accordance with all Governmental &#13;&#10;Approvals, (ii) diligently prosecuted to completion and in a manner so as to minimize any &#13;&#10;interruption in any other Owners&#39; use and enjoyment of its respective easements granted &#13;&#10;hereunder and (iii) performed and undertaken in accordance with all of the terms and conditions &#13;&#10;of this Agreement and any applicable Other Documents. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage313"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- SLIDE 0219 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023219.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 219" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement- I I &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. Relocation Rights. In the event that, after the date hereof, an Owner (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Relocating Owner&quot;) desires to relocate an Easement Area located on the Relocating Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;respective Property, the Relocating Owner shall notify the other Owners having an Easement &#13;&#10;therein and their respective Major Tenants (if any) (each, as applicable, the &quot;Other Parties&quot;) of &#13;&#10;such desire, which notice shall include a plan and description of the proposed new location &#13;&#10;therefor (and the reason for such relocation), and the date (which shall be not less than sixty (60) &#13;&#10;days after the date of such notice) on which the Relocating Owner would propose such relocation &#13;&#10;to become effective. A Relocating Owner shall have the right to relocate any such Easement &#13;&#10;Area so long as the relocation shall not, other than to a de minimis extent, increase the burdens &#13;&#10;on, or decrease the rights of, any of the Other Parties, as determined in each of their respective &#13;&#10;reasonable discretion. Furthermore, with respect to any such relocation: (i) such relocation shall &#13;&#10;be planned and undertaken at the Relocating Owner&#39;s sole cost and expense; (ii) the Relocating &#13;&#10;Owner shall obtain any and all Governmental Approvals required therefor at its sole cost and &#13;&#10;expense; and (iii) the relocation shall be conducted in accordance with all of the terms and &#13;&#10;conditions of this Agreement and any applicable Other Documents. The Other Parties shall &#13;&#10;cooperate, in all reasonable respects (but at no out-of-pocket cost to such Other Parties) with the &#13;&#10;Relocating Owner in obtaining and maintaining any Governmental Approvals under this &#13;&#10;paragraph. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;C. Requests for Approvals, Consents and Determinations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) With respect to any matter as to which any Owner (or any Major Tenant) &#13;&#10;hereunder shall be given an approval, consent or other determination-making right, such right &#13;&#10;shall, except as otherwise expressly provided herein, be exercised in such party&#39;s sole and &#13;&#10;absolute discretion, and any such exercise shall not be deemed inconsistent with any covenant of &#13;&#10;good faith and fair dealing which may be implied by law to be part of this Agreement. The &#13;&#10;parties intend by this Agreement to set forth their entire understanding with respect to the terms, &#13;&#10;covenants, conditions and standards pursuant to which their obligations are to be judged and &#13;&#10;their performance measured. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) Unless provision is made hereunder for a specific time period, each &#13;&#10;response to a request for an approval, consent or other determination to be made or considered &#13;&#10;pursuant to this Agreement (a &quot;Response Request&quot;) shall be given by the Owner (and any &#13;&#10;applicable Major Tenant) to whom directed within thirty (30) days after receipt thereof. Each &#13;&#10;such response shall be in writing and the reasons for any disapproval, denial or other negative &#13;&#10;response shall be stated in reasonable detail. If a response is not given by the requested Owner &#13;&#10;(or applicable Major Tenant) within the required time period, then the requesting Owner may &#13;&#10;provide a second Response Request to the requested Owner (or applicable Major Tenant) stating &#13;&#10;in capitalized letters that failure to respond within the applicable time period will be deemed to &#13;&#10;constitute the giving of the requested approval, consent or other determination and, if no &#13;&#10;response to the second Response Request is given by the Owner (or applicable Major Tenant) &#13;&#10;within fifteen (15) days ofreceipt thereof, then the requested Owner (or applicable Major &#13;&#10;Tenant) shall be deemed to have given the requested approval, consent or other determination. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, the provisions of this Section C do &#13;&#10;not apply in any manner or fashion to any request for or which may require an amendment to this &#13;&#10;Agreement, such requests being governed solely by the provisions of Section V.J. below. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-12 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;III. MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Maintenance and Operation of Properties and Easement Areas. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Except for such obligations that are otherwise specifically allocated &#13;&#10;between the Owners pursuant to this Agreement or another agreement of record affecting the &#13;&#10;Properties, each Owner shall be solely responsible for maintaining and operating the Exterior &#13;&#10;Elements of its respective Property in a sightly manner and, in any event, in keeping with the &#13;&#10;standards of a first class office, research and development and/or light manufacturing facility in &#13;&#10;the greater Boston, Massachusetts area. Each Owner shall bear the costs of such maintenance on &#13;&#10;the Owner&#39;s respective Property (the &quot;Maintenance Costs&quot;), including such maintenance of the &#13;&#10;Easement Areas within the Owner&#39;s respective Property, without right to charge the other Owner &#13;&#10;therefor (except as otherwise expressly set forth herein). Such maintenance will include, but not &#13;&#10;be limited to: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) snow and ice removal from any driveways, walkways, stairways, &#13;&#10;parking areas and other paved areas (the &quot;Paved Areas&quot;); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) patching, repaving, or replacing pavement in Paved Areas; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) illumination of Paved Areas; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) landscaping; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) maintenance of the Stormwater System in accordance with all &#13;&#10;Governmental Approvals. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&quot;Exterior Elements&quot; shall mean all non-building outdoor areas (including without limitation all &#13;&#10;grounds, lawns, patios, landscaped areas, driveways, walkways, parking areas and open spaces &#13;&#10;within the Easement Areas). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) Each Owner may itself perform its responsibilities hereunder or may &#13;&#10;contract with reputable and experienced contractors and service companies to provide any or all &#13;&#10;of such services. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(iii) Subject to the terms, requirements and conditions set forth herein, each &#13;&#10;Owner hereby grants to the other Owners an easement over the Property of such Owner to the &#13;&#10;extent necessary to allow each of the other Owners, its employees, contractors and &#13;&#10;representatives, to perform the work required or permitted to be performed by each such Owner &#13;&#10;hereunder and solely for such purposes. Each such Owner hereby covenants and agrees to &#13;&#10;exercise the foregoing easement rights in a manner so as not to unreasonably interfere with the &#13;&#10;use and enjoyment by any other Owner and its tenants (including any Major Tenant) of its &#13;&#10;respective Property and agrees that promptly following any work performed which involves &#13;&#10;excavation or otherwise disturbs any Property to restore said Property to at least as good a &#13;&#10;condition as that existing prior to the commencement of such work. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in Section III.A. above, the 100 &#13;&#10;Owner shall reimburse the 144 Owner for percent (_ %) of the 144 Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-13 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Maintenance Costs within thirty (30) days of receiving an itemized statement of such costs &#13;&#10;(supported by reasonable evidence of such costs), any such statement to be delivered from time &#13;&#10;to time but not more frequently than once per calendar month. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;C. Self Help Rights. In the event that an Owner (a &quot;non-performing Owner&quot;) fails &#13;&#10;to perform any of the work or services required to be performed by such Owner hereunder in any &#13;&#10;Easement Area, and such failure continues for thirty (30) days following written notice thereof &#13;&#10;from any other Owner (a &quot;performing Owner&quot;) to the non-performing Owner and its Major &#13;&#10;Tenant (if any) or, if said failure is not reasonably susceptible of cure within such 30 days, for &#13;&#10;such additional period as is reasonable under the circumstances so long as the non-performing &#13;&#10;Owner commenced cure within such 30 days and thereafter prosecuted such cure to completion &#13;&#10;with due diligence, (except in the case of emergency in which case no prior written notice and &#13;&#10;cure period shall be required so long as the performing Owner shall, within five (5) days &#13;&#10;following the taking of any action pursuant to this Section C, notify the non-performing Owner &#13;&#10;and its Major Tenant (if any) of the same), then any such performing Owner shall have the right, &#13;&#10;at its sole option, to perform or cause to be performed such obligations in the Easement Areas, at &#13;&#10;any time thereafter until the condition has been cured, and without waiving any claim for &#13;&#10;damages for breach of this Agreement, and any reasonable amount paid or contractual liability &#13;&#10;incurred by such performing Owner in so doing, shall be deemed paid or incurred for the account &#13;&#10;of the non-performing Owner, and the non-performing Owner shall reimburse the performing &#13;&#10;Owner therefor within twenty (20) days of demand (which demand shall include an itemized &#13;&#10;statement of the amounts claimed, supported by reasonable evidence thereof). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;D. Lien for Nonpayment. In the event of a default in the payment by an Owner of &#13;&#10;any amounts due as and when required under Section III.B. or Section III.C., such amounts, &#13;&#10;together with all reasonable costs of collection (including but not limited to attorneys&#39; fees, &#13;&#10;whether suit be brought or not), shall accrue with interest thereon at the Interest Rate. All such &#13;&#10;unpaid amounts (including such costs of collection and interest) shall constitute a lien against the &#13;&#10;Property of the defaulting Owner in order to secure the payment thereof. The existence of said &#13;&#10;lien shall be evidenced upon recording with the Registry and filing with the Land Court of a &#13;&#10;notice or statement thereof by the Owner to whom the amounts are due. Such lien shall relate &#13;&#10;back to the date of this Agreement and be prior and superior to all liens and encumbrances of &#13;&#10;record against the Property of the defaulting Owner on or after the date of this Agreement; &#13;&#10;provided, however, that any such lien shall be subject and subordinate to the lien of any &#13;&#10;mortgage on such Property now or hereafter held by any Qualified Lender that is placed of &#13;&#10;record prior to the recording of any lien notice or statement as provided for in this Section D. As &#13;&#10;used herein, &quot;Interest Rate&quot; shall mean an annual rate equal to 4% per annum in excess of the &#13;&#10;prime rate of interest published from time to time in the Wall Street Journal-Eastern Edition (but &#13;&#10;in no event shall such rate of interest exceed the maximum rate of interest permitted to be &#13;&#10;charged by law). As used herein, &quot;Qualified Lender&quot; shall mean a bank, savings bank, savings &#13;&#10;and loan association, trust company, credit union or similar such institution, insurance company, &#13;&#10;pension plan, employee benefit plan, REIT, REMIC, or trustee under a commercial mortgage &#13;&#10;backed securities issue or similar conduit lender, or an entity directly or indirectly controlling, &#13;&#10;controlled by, or in common control with any of the foregoing. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;IV. INSURANCE AND INDEMNIFICATION &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Insurance. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Each of the Owners covenants and agrees to maintain or cause to be &#13;&#10;maintained at all times during the term of this Agreement, with respect to all Easement Areas &#13;&#10;located on such Owner&#39;s Property, a policy of commercial general liability insurance in which &#13;&#10;the primary coverage per accident or occurrence is not less than $1,000,000.00 of primary &#13;&#10;combined single limit and the umbrella coverage per accident or occurrence is not less than &#13;&#10;$5,000,000.00 in the aggregate, with each such policy naming each of the other Owners (and, in &#13;&#10;the case where there is a Ground Lease (as defined herein) in effect, the fee owner of the ground &#13;&#10;leased Property), its Major Tenant (if any) and the mortgagees (if any) of any of the foregoing &#13;&#10;parties, as additional insureds. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) All policies of insurance required to be maintained under this Agreement &#13;&#10;may be furnished under any blanket policy (provided the minimum limits set forth herein are &#13;&#10;specified) or under a separate policy therefor. The insurance shall be with carriers with a Best &#13;&#10;Insurance rating of &quot;A-&quot; or better and a financial size rating of &quot;VIII&quot; or better and with &#13;&#10;companies qualified to do business in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and in good standing &#13;&#10;therein. Certificates of the insurers, on the ACORD standard or equivalent forms, evidencing the &#13;&#10;maintenance of such insurance policies shall be delivered to any party entitled to be named &#13;&#10;thereunder at the time such party is first entitled to be named thereunder and, upon renewals, not &#13;&#10;less than ten (I 0) days prior to the expiration of a coverage period. At any time after the third &#13;&#10;(3rd) anniversary of the date of this Agreement, any minimum dollar coverage requirements set &#13;&#10;forth herein shall be subject to increase to levels customarily required for similar risks at similar &#13;&#10;properties in eastern Massachusetts, upon an Owner&#39;s election by notice to another applicable &#13;&#10;Owner given from time to time (but not more than once in any given period of three (3) years). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. Indemnification. Each Owner (an &quot;Indemnifying Owner&quot;) hereby indemnifies &#13;&#10;and holds harmless the other Owners (and, in the case where there is a Ground Lease in effect, &#13;&#10;the fee owner of the ground leased Property), their respective Major Tenants (if any) and the &#13;&#10;respective mortgagees (if any) of any of the foregoing parties (each, an &quot;Indemnified Party&quot;) &#13;&#10;from any and all losses, liabilities, claims, expenses and costs (including reasonable attorneys &#13;&#10;fees) arising out of (A) any accident, injury or damage whatsoever caused to any person, or to &#13;&#10;the property of any person, occurring in or about (i) the Property of the Indemnifying Owner &#13;&#10;except to the extent caused by the act or omission of the Indemnified Party and/or (ii) the &#13;&#10;Property of the Indemnified Owner to the extent such accident, injury or damage is caused by the &#13;&#10;act or omission of the Indemnifying Party, and (B) any default by an Indemnifying Party of its &#13;&#10;obligations under this Agreement. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;V. MISCELLANEOUS &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. Ground Lessees and Major Tenants. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) The rights and obligations of any Owner hereunder may, at the Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;election, be assigned, in whole (but not in part except as expressly set forth herein), to a Ground &#13;&#10;Lessee of such Owner&#39;s Property provided such Ground Lessee expressly assumes the rights and &#13;&#10;obligations of such Owner for the term of the Ground Lease. Such assignment and assumption &#13;&#10;shall be effected by (I) the execution by such Owner and Ground Lessee of a written instrument &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Reciprocal Easement Agreement-14 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;memorializing the same and containing the name and address for notices of the Ground Lessee &#13;&#10;(the &quot;Assignment Instrument&quot;), (2) the recording with the Middlesex County North Registry of &#13;&#10;Deeds (the &quot;Registry&quot;) and/or filing with the Middlesex County (North) Registry District of the &#13;&#10;Land Court (the &quot;Land Court&quot;), as applicable, of the Assignment Instrument and (3) the &#13;&#10;delivery of a copy of the Assignment Instrument to the other Owners (and their respective Major &#13;&#10;Tenants, if any); provided that if such assignment and assumption shall be set forth in the &#13;&#10;Ground Lease then the foregoing requirements of this sentence shall be deemed satisfied by (x) &#13;&#10;the recording with the Registry and/or filing with the Land Court, as applicable, of a notice of &#13;&#10;lease for the Ground Lease in accordance with Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 183, &#13;&#10;Section 4, which notice of lease shall contain a statement that the Ground Lease includes such &#13;&#10;assignment and assumption, and (y) the delivery of a copy of such notice of lease to the other &#13;&#10;Owners (and their respective Major Tenants, if any), and any such notice of lease shall be &#13;&#10;deemed to constitute an Assignment Instrument. Under no circumstances shall any such &#13;&#10;assignment of obligations to a Ground Lessee relieve the assigning Owner of its primary liability &#13;&#10;for such obligations. As used herein, &quot;Ground Lease&quot; shall mean, with respect to a particular &#13;&#10;Owner and its particular Property, a lease by the Owner of all of the land comprising such &#13;&#10;Property and any or all of the Owner&#39;s interests in any improvements located thereon, and &#13;&#10;&quot;Ground Lessee&quot; shall mean the lessee under a Ground Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(ii) In addition to the rights afforded under the preceding clause (i), any &#13;&#10;Owner may, at the Owner&#39;s election, designate a Major Tenant on such Owner&#39;s Property to &#13;&#10;have the rights expressly set forth in this Agreement as being for the benefit of a Major Tenant, &#13;&#10;provided that in no event shall any such Major Tenant have any obligations under this &#13;&#10;Agreement (as opposed to under its respective Major Lease) except to the extent expressly set &#13;&#10;forth herein. Such designation shall be effected by (1) the execution by such Owner of a written &#13;&#10;instrument memorializing the same and containing the name and address for notices of the Major &#13;&#10;Tenant (the &quot;Designation Instrument&quot;), (2) the recording with the Registry and/or filing with &#13;&#10;the Land Court, as applicable, of the Designation Instrument and (3) the delivery of a copy of &#13;&#10;the Designation Instrument to the other Owners (and their respective Major Tenants, if any); &#13;&#10;provided that if such designation shall be set forth in the Major Lease then the foregoing &#13;&#10;requirements of this sentence shall be deemed satisfied by (x) the recording with the Registry &#13;&#10;and/or filing with the Land Court, as applicable, of a notice of lease for the Major Lease in &#13;&#10;accordance with Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 183, Section 4, which notice of lease shall &#13;&#10;contain a statement that the Major Lease includes such designation, and (y) the delivery of a &#13;&#10;copy of such notice of lease to the other Owners (and their respective Major Tenants, if any), and &#13;&#10;any such notice of lease shall be deemed to constitute an Assignment Instrument. As used &#13;&#10;herein, &quot;Major Lease&quot; shall mean, with respect to a particular Owner and its particular Property, &#13;&#10;a lease by the Owner of more than 50% of the gross floor area of all buildings located on such &#13;&#10;Property, and &quot;Major Tenant&quot; shall mean the tenant under a Major Lease. It is acknowledged &#13;&#10;that (AA) pursuant to the 144 Notice of Lease, the 144 Tenant has been designated as the Major &#13;&#10;Tenant of the 144 Property, (BB) pursuant to the 100 Notice of Lease, the 100 Tenant has been &#13;&#10;designated as the Major Tenant of the 100 Property, and (CC) pursuant to the Hale Notice of &#13;&#10;Lease, the Hale Tenant has been designated as the Major Tenant of the Hale Property. In no &#13;&#10;event shall there be more than one Major Lease in effect at any given time with respect to any &#13;&#10;particular Property. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Reciprocal Easement Agreement-IS &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

Limitation of Liability. No partner, member, shareholder, trustee, beneficiary, &#13;&#10;director, officer, manager, or employee of any Owner, or any affiliate of such Owner, shall have &#13;&#10;any personal liability under this Agreement. In addition, no Owner shall have personal liability &#13;&#10;under this Agreement and, in the event any person obtains a judgment against any Owner in &#13;&#10;connection with this Agreement, such person&#39;s sole recourse shall be to such Owner&#39;s interest in &#13;&#10;the applicable Property; provided, however, that the foregoing limitation of liability shall not &#13;&#10;apply in the event of any fraud, intentional misrepresentation, or intentional misconduct by such &#13;&#10;Owner. In addition, each Owner shall be bound by this Agreement only during the period such &#13;&#10;Owner is the owner of the fee (or, in the case of a Ground Lessee, leasehold) of the Owner&#39;s &#13;&#10;respective Property, or portion of the Property; and, upon conveyance or transfer of such fee (or &#13;&#10;leasehold) interest, shall be released from liability hereunder. In no event shall any Owner be &#13;&#10;liable under this Agreement for any indirect, consequential, special or punitive damages incurred &#13;&#10;by another Owner under this Agreement. Any Major Tenant shall be entitled to the same &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-18 &#13;&#10;limitations of liability as are afforded to its respective Owner under this Section F, mutatis &#13;&#10;mutandis. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;G. Severability. If any provision, including any phrase, sentence, clause, section or &#13;&#10;subsection, of this Agreement is determined by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, &#13;&#10;inoperative or unenforceable for any reason, such circumstances shall not, if the rights and &#13;&#10;obligations of the parties hereto will not be materially and adversely affected thereby, have the &#13;&#10;effect of rendering such provision in question invalid, inoperative or unenforceable in any other &#13;&#10;case or circumstance, or of rendering any other provision herein contained invalid, inoperative or &#13;&#10;unenforceable to any extent whatsoever. Upon any such determination, the parties shall negotiate &#13;&#10;in good faith to modify this Agreement so as to effect the original intent of the parties as closely &#13;&#10;as possible in an acceptable manner in order that the transactions contemplated hereby be &#13;&#10;consummated as originally contemplated to the fullest extent possible. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;H. Headings. The words &quot;hereof&#39;, &quot;herein&quot; and &quot;hereunder&quot; and words of like &#13;&#10;import used in this Agreement shall refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any &#13;&#10;particular provision of this Agreement. The words &quot;party&quot; or &quot;parties&quot; shall refer to any or all &#13;&#10;of the Owners and applicable Major Tenants. The captions herein are included for &#13;&#10;convenience of reference only and shall be ignored in the construction or interpretation &#13;&#10;hereof. References to Sections are to Sections of this Agreement unless otherwise specified. &#13;&#10;Any singular term in this Agreement shall be deemed to include the plural, and any plural &#13;&#10;term the singular. Whenever the words &quot;include&quot;, &quot;includes&quot; or &quot;including&quot; are used in this &#13;&#10;Agreement, they shall be deemed to be followed by the words &quot;without limitation&quot;, whether &#13;&#10;or not they are in fact followed by those words or words of like import. &quot;Writing&quot;, &quot;written&quot; &#13;&#10;and comparable terms refer to printing, typing and other means of reproducing words &#13;&#10;(including electronic media) in a visible form. References to any agreement or contract are to &#13;&#10;that agreement or contract as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time in &#13;&#10;accordance with the terms hereof and thereof. References to any person include the &#13;&#10;successors and permitted assigns of that person. References from or through any date mean, &#13;&#10;unless otherwise specified, from and including or through and including, respectively. Any &#13;&#10;reference to &quot;days&quot; means calendar days unless business days are expressly specified. If any &#13;&#10;action under this Agreement is required to be done or taken on a day that is not a business &#13;&#10;day, then such action shall be required to be done or taken not on such day but on the first &#13;&#10;succeeding business day thereafter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;I. Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in several counterparts, each of &#13;&#10;which shall be an original but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;J. Amendment and Termination. This Agreement may be amended, modified, or &#13;&#10;terminated at any time by a declaration in writing mutually agreed to, executed and &#13;&#10;acknowledged by each of the Owners and applicable Major Tenants, and thereafter duly filed in &#13;&#10;the Land Court and recorded with the Registry. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;K. Benefit. The easements, rights and uses granted and reserved in this Agreement &#13;&#10;are not intended to create, nor shall they be construed as creating any rights for the benefit of &#13;&#10;the general public or any third party; rather, the easements, rights and uses granted and &#13;&#10;reserved in this Agreement shall be for the benefit of, and restricted solely to, the Owners from &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage321"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0227 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023227.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 227" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-19 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;time to time of the Properties and their tenants (including any Major Tenants) or other devisees &#13;&#10;as expressly authorized hereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;L. Limitations on Time. The Owners intend that the provisions of this Agreement &#13;&#10;shall not be subject to the Statutory Rule Against Perpetuities or any rule of law with respect to &#13;&#10;restriction on the alienation of property or remoteness of vesting of property interests, and each &#13;&#10;of the Owners hereby agrees that such Owner will not make any contrary assertion or seek the &#13;&#10;benefit of the Statutory Rule Against Perpetuities or other such rule of law, in any dispute arising &#13;&#10;under this Agreement. In the event, however, that the Statutory Rule Against Perpetuities, or &#13;&#10;similar rule of law shall limit the time within which any restriction in this Agreement may be &#13;&#10;valid or enforceable, such restriction is imposed for a period of ninety (90) years from the date of &#13;&#10;recording of this Agreement in the Registry and filing of this Agreement in the Land Court, and &#13;&#10;it is intended that the enforceability of any such restriction be extended beyond thirty (30) years &#13;&#10;from the date of recording of this Declaration in the Registry and filing in the Land Court. As &#13;&#10;provided under Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 184, Section 27, as amended, the term of &#13;&#10;the restrictions under this Agreement may be extended, for additional periods not exceeding &#13;&#10;twenty (20) years each, by the recording in the Registry and the filing in the Land Court before &#13;&#10;the expiration of thirty (30) years and before the expiration of any subsequent twenty (20) year &#13;&#10;extension period, as applicable, of an instrument of extension executed by any of the Owners &#13;&#10;benefitting from such restriction(s) at the time such instrument of extension is recorded and filed, &#13;&#10;or for such longer periods and/or by such other lawful means to the fullest extent as may be &#13;&#10;available under applicable law. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;M. Estoppel Certificates. Upon fifteen (15) days&#39; prior written notice, given in &#13;&#10;connection with the transfer, financing and/or refinancing of any of the Properties and otherwise &#13;&#10;no more than once in any calendar year, each of the Owners (and any Major Tenant) agrees to &#13;&#10;provide to the requesting Owner, or its purchaser or lender, as the case may be, an estoppel &#13;&#10;certificate stating, to its actual knowledge: (a) whether the Owner (or Major Tenant) knows of &#13;&#10;any defaults or other sums owed under this Agreement on the part of the requesting Owner and, &#13;&#10;if so, the nature thereof; (b) whether this Agreement has been assigned by the Owner (or Major &#13;&#10;Tenant), or modified or amended in any way and, if so, the nature thereof; (c) that this &#13;&#10;Agreement is in full force and effect as of the date of such estoppel certificate and (d) any other &#13;&#10;information reasonably required by the requesting Owner (including without limitation whether &#13;&#10;any amounts are due and owing to an Owner under the provisions of Section III.B. or Section &#13;&#10;III.C. above). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;N. Binding Obligations/Successors and Assigns; No Merger. All easements, &#13;&#10;rights and obligations under this Agreement shall run with the land and shall be binding upon, &#13;&#10;enforceable by and against, and inure to the benefit of the Owners and their respective successors &#13;&#10;and assigns in title. If at any time the interests under this Agreement of any two or more Owners &#13;&#10;are held by one and the same person or entity then, for all intents and purposes under this &#13;&#10;Agreement, such interests shall be deemed separate and distinct and shall not be deemed to have &#13;&#10;been thereby merged or extinguished, unless and only to the extent that the Owners expressly &#13;&#10;agree otherwise by an instrument recorded with the Registry and filed in the Land Court &#13;&#10;subsequent to the recording and filing hereof. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage322"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0228 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/17/0001493594-16-000016_EXH-1023228.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 228" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	Reciprocal Easement Agreement-20 &#13;&#10;0. No Waiver. Failure on the part of one Owner (or Major Tenant) to complain of &#13;&#10;any action or non-action on the part of the other Owner, no matter how long the same may &#13;&#10;continue, shall never be a waiver by such Owner (or Major Tenant) of any of its rights &#13;&#10;hereunder. Further, no waiver at any time of any of the provisions hereof by one Owner (or &#13;&#10;Major Tenant) shall be construed as a waiver of any of the other provisions hereof, and a waiver &#13;&#10;at any time of any of the provisions hereof shall not be construed as a waiver of the same &#13;&#10;provisions at any subsequent time. The consent or approval of one Owner (or Major Tenant) to &#13;&#10;or of any action by the other Owner requiring such consent or approval shall not be construed to &#13;&#10;waive or render unnecessary such Owner&#39;s (or Major Tenant&#39;s) consent or approval to or of any &#13;&#10;subsequent similar act by such other Owner. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;P. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed in all respects, including as &#13;&#10;to validity, interpretation and effect, by the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, &#13;&#10;without giving effect to its principles or rules of conflict of laws, to the extent such principles or &#13;&#10;rules are not mandatorily applicable by statute and would permit or require the application of &#13;&#10;the laws of another jurisdiction, except to the extent that certain matters are preempted by &#13;&#10;federal law or are governed by the law of the jurisdiction of organization of any party or other &#13;&#10;entity referred to herein. The parties hereby irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of &#13;&#10;the courts of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and the federal courts of the United States of &#13;&#10;America located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, and the appropriate appellate courts &#13;&#10;thereof, solely in respect of the interpretation and enforcement of the provisions of this &#13;&#10;Agreement and in respect of the transactions contemplated hereby. The parties irrevocably &#13;&#10;agree that all claims in respect of the interpretation and enforcement of the provisions of this &#13;&#10;Agreement and in respect of the transactions contemplated hereby, or with respect to any such, &#13;&#10;claims, dispute action or proceeding, shall be heard and determined in such a Commonwealth of &#13;&#10;Massachusetts state or federal court, and that such jurisdiction of such courts with respect &#13;&#10;thereto shall be exclusive, except solely to the extent that all such courts shall lawfully decline &#13;&#10;to exercise such jurisdiction. The parties hereby waive, and agree not to assert, as a defense in &#13;&#10;any action, dispute, suit or proceeding for the interpretation or enforcement hereof or in &#13;&#10;respect of any such transaction, that it is not subject to such jurisdiction. The parties hereby &#13;&#10;waive, and agree not to assert, to the maximum extent permitted by law, as a defense in any &#13;&#10;action, dispute, suit or proceeding for the interpretation or enforcement hereof or in respect of &#13;&#10;any such transaction, that such action, suit or proceeding may not be brought or is not &#13;&#10;maintainable in such courts or that the venue thereof may not be appropriate or that this &#13;&#10;Agreement may not be enforced in or by such courts. The parties hereby consent to and grant &#13;&#10;any such court jurisdiction over the person of such parties and over the subject matter of any &#13;&#10;such dispute. EACH PARTY HEREBY IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY &#13;&#10;WAIVES ANY RIGHT SUCH PARTY MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT &#13;&#10;OF ANY LITIGATION DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING &#13;&#10;TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Q. Specific Performance. The parties agree that irreparable damage would occur if &#13;&#10;any provision of this Agreement were not performed in accordance with the terms hereof and &#13;&#10;that the parties shall be entitled to an injunction or injunctions to enforce specifically the &#13;&#10;performance of the terms and provisions hereof in any court specified in Section V.P. The &#13;&#10;parties hereby waive, in any action for specific performance, the defense of adequacy of a &#13;&#10;remedy at law and the posting of any bond or other security in connection therewith. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;R. Costs of Collection. Should any party hereto commence any legal action against &#13;&#10;another party hereto to enforce any obligation under this Agreement, the prevailing party (as &#13;&#10;determined in such action) shall be entitled to recover from the non-prevailing party reasonable &#13;&#10;attorneys&#39; fees, costs and expenses incurred in contesting such dispute. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;S. No Documentary Stamps. No documentary stamps are attached, none being &#13;&#10;required by law, as the consideration paid for this grant is less than One Hundred Dollars &#13;&#10;($100.00). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;T. Further Assurances. The parties agree that at any time and from time to time &#13;&#10;after the execution and delivery of this Agreement, the parties shall, upon the request of the &#13;&#10;other of them, execute and deliver such further documents and do such further acts and things as &#13;&#10;the requesting party may reasonably request in order to more fully carry out the purposes of this &#13;&#10;Agreement. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;[szgnatures commence on the following page] &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Reciprocal Easement Agreement-21 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

	EXHIBIT 23.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</DIV>
<EFX_EXPERTS_CONSENT>
<A NAME="FIS_EXPERTS_CONSENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We consent to the incorporation by reference in Registration Statements No. 333-209610, No. 333-193098, and No. 333-180219 on Form S-8 and Registration Statement No. 333-188728 and No. 333-201827 on Form S-3 of our reports dated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	November&#160;17, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, relating to the consolidated financial statements of MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc., and the effectiveness of MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc.&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting appearing in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	September&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXHIBIT 31.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:26PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CERTIFICATION OF THE CEO PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I, John Croteau, certify that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc.;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&#160;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&#160;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	b)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	c)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	d)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>

</TD>

</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

	b)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	Date:
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	11/17/2016

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:1PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:1PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-INDENT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	/s/ John Croteau
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

	John Croteau

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:26PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CERTIFICATION OF THE CFO PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I, Robert J. McMullan, certify that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc.;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:30PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:30PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&#160;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&#160;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	b)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:66PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	c)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

	d)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	5.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	a)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</EFX_CERTIFICATION>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXHIBIT 32.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:26PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350, AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the Annual Report of MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	September&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), John Croteau, as President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, and Robert J. McMullan, as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, each hereby certifies, pursuant to and solely for the purpose of 18 U.S.C. Section&#160;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&#160;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:18PX;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:54PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:18PX;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company for the period covered by the Report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:9PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
